loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia de 50 años, es una mujer trabajadora, es madre de dos hijos a quienes desea darle lo mejor. Reside en una vivienda construida a base de madera.
Siempre dedicada a su familia, dejó de lado las actividades agrícolas para probar suerte e incursionar en el rubro dedicado a la venta de agregados para construcción. Esto gracias con un dinero ahorrado para un nuevo negocio logró acceder en la compra de un pequeño cargador frontal que sería usado con ayuda de un chofer para la extracción de arena fina y hormigón de las riberas del río en su localidad.
Lleva 3 años en el rubro y comenta que al inicio no fue nada sencillo organizar dichas actividades por falta de clientes, no obstante su puntualidad y compromiso de trabajo terminaron por hacerla conocida en su localidad y por consiguiente consolidar su negocio como un buen sustento para la economía familiar.
A manera de agilizar el pago total de su herramienta de trabajo desea contar con su entidad financiera para al pago del mismo.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a la compra de un camión para agilizar el traslado de los agregados. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y culminar el pago de su cargador frontal .
texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old, and is a hard-working woman. She is the mother of two children and wants the best for them. She lives in a house made of wood.
Always looking for the best for her family, she stopped working in agriculture to try her luck selling building aggregates (the sand and stone used in concrete). Thanks to the money she had previously saved, she managed to buy a small front end loader, which is operated by a driver to extract fine sand and cement from the riverbanks where she lives.
She has been working for three years in this industry and comments that, at the beginning, it was not easy because she did not have many customers. Nevertheless, her punctuality and commitment resulted in her becoming well-known in her local area and consequently she strengthened her business to be able to support her family financially.
To pay off the balance of her work tools more quickly, she would like to have financial support.
Her future plans include the purchase of van to facilitate the transportation of the aggregates. At this time, she is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevo soles to complete the payment of her front end loader.

loans.use: to pay off the balance of her front end loader.

loans.name: Relita

texts.en:
Relita, 50 years of age, is a single mother of two children. They are currently residing in the village of San Fermin. 

Relita owns and operates a vegetable-vending business in which she sells onions, ginger, and garlic. She's been in this business for almost 16 years. With this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 10,000 per month. 

She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase onions, ginger, and garlic. Relita also sells vinegar, soy sauce, and fish sauce, for additional income. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase onions, ginger, and garlic for her business.

loans.name: Lister

texts.es:
En la cálida ciudad de Aguaytia vive Lister un joven de 32 años de edad, padre de 2 maravillosos hijos de 2 años de edad y por los cuales lucha cada día para poder sacarlos adelante, ya que para Lister es el regalo más grande que Dios le ha dado y son el motor y motivo de sus alegrías y son la fuerza para seguir viviendo y luchando por mejorar cada día. Lister en su tiempo libre disfruta de hacer deporte, en especial le gusta jugar fútbol y también en ocasiones le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Pollo a la Brasa”. Con mucho esfuerzo el logro estudiar la carrera de Mecánica automotriz y luego de mucho ahorro logro iniciar su pequeño negocio de reparación de automóviles, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 5 clientes diariamente; él cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es puntual y honrado con los clientes y por ello siempre lo recomiendan.

Lister está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando el podrá comprar herramientas y repuesto para su negocio así como también podrá comprar una compresora de aire, lo cual le permitirá poder realizar mejor su trabajo y atender a sus clientes de mejor manera ya que contara con los implementos necesarios.
texts.en:
In the warm city of Aguaytia lives Lister, a young man of 32 years who is the father of two wonderful children who are 2 years old and for whom he struggles every day in order to be able to get them ahead in life, since for Lister they are the greatest gift that God has given him.  They are the motor and motive of his happiness and they are the strength to continue living and striving to improve every day.  Lister, in his free time, enjoys playing sports, he especially likes to play soccer and also, on occasion, he loves to eat one of his favorite dishes which is the most delicious “Pollo a la Brasa” (a Peruvian roasted chicken dish).  

With a lot of effort he managed to study auto mechanics and after much saving he managed to start his small auto repair business.  He devotes around 9 hours a day to his business and can serve up to 5 clients daily.  He believes that he is moving forward with his business because he is punctual and honest with his customers and because of this they always recommend him.

Lister is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the support that they are providing him, he will be able to purchase tools and spare parts for his business as well as an air compressor, which will allow him to be able to perform his work better and serve his clients in a better way since he will have the necessary implements.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, tools and an air compressor.

loans.name: Helaman Jose

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Camana donde se encuentran playas preciosas y se puede apreciar una gastronomía variada entre los cuales figura uno de sus mas deliciosos platillos el cual es el riquísimo “Chupe de Camarones”; vive Helaman, un  hombre muy trabajador y con muchos deseos de salir adelante, es por ello que cada día Helaman trabaja como Ayudante de construcción en cuanta construcción pueda haber en la ciudad ya que él apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 2 clientes al día, pero depende del tamaño de la construcción que realice; el cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y trabaja de manera honrada.

Helaman está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda en especial mejorar las paredes ya que se encuentran muy agrietadas, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Comprar una moto para poder movilizarse mejor”.
texts.en:
Helaman lives in the city of Camana where beautiful beaches are found and a varied cuisine can be enjoyed; among the dishes is one of the most delicious: “Chupe de Camarones.  He’s a very hardworking man who very much wants to get ahead which is why Helaman works as an assistant in construction in whatever construction projects are current in the city because he helps his parents to cover household expenses.  He works about 9 hours daily and can take care of up to 2 customers per day depending on the size of the construction project it is.  He believes he’s getting ahead because he’s very responsible and works in an honest way.

Helaman is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he’ll be able to make some home improvements, especially the walls that are quite cracked thus improving his family’s quality of life and continuing to strive to make his greatest dream reality: to buy a motorcycle to get around better.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Segundo Uldarico

texts.es:
Segundo  tiene 60 años de edad pero tiene una vitalidad y una alegría de un joven de 15 años, ya que no se deja ganar por el mal humor no va a trabajar bien y sobre todo no podrá estar bien para su familia, vive al lado de su esposa quien es su mano derecha y sobre todo su amiga y el hombro en el cual él se puede recostar cuando necesita de un apoyo y también al lado de sus 3 hijos quienes son su motor y motivo para vivir; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camaná, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso,  se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, entre otros y tiene una gastronomía variada. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado tener una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo el deseo de Salir adelante Segundo trabaja en su parcela en la cual cosecha arroz, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día, sobre todo porque siempre vela porque a sus plantas no le de ninguna plaga para que su cosecha sea buena; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado y muy conocido por los clientes.

Segundo está muy feliz y agradecido por la ayuda que le han brindado los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar insumos, fertilizantes y abono para su plantas y así poder mejorar la cosecha y mejorar su ingreso, de esta manera el podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa de material Noble”.
texts.en:
Segundo is sixty-years-old but according to him has the vitality and cheerfulness of a fifteen-year-old youngster because for him, if he lets a bad mood take over he won’t work well and above all will be unable to be good for his family. He lives with his wife who is his right hand and above all his friend and the shoulder upon which he can rely whenever he needs support.  He also lives with his three children who are his motivating force and reason for living.  His house is located in the city of Camaná which is noted for having a hot climate.  Agriculture, especially rice growing among others, takes place there and it also has a varied cuisine.  Because of his limited economic resources, he was only able to study up to fifth grade in secondary school but he would have liked to have gone to university.

With much effort and above all with the wish to move forward, Segundo works his parcel of land where he grows rice.  He spends about 10 hours daily at his business above all because he always is careful that his plants are safe from any infestation so his yields will be good.  He believes he does well in his business because he’s very dedicated and well-known by customers.

Segundo is very happy and grateful for the support he’s gotten from Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy  supplies, fertilizer and manure for his plants to improve harvest and income so he can continue striving daily to make his greatest dream reality: to finish building his house out of substantial materials.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mbelayiif 1 Group

texts.fr: "Mbelayiif" est un groupe mixte de six personnes dont deux femmes.Tous les membres du groupement sont mariés. Chaque année , ils achètent des bœufs qu'ils engraissent et revendent sur le marché afin de renforcer leurs revenus.Cette opération leur permet de mieux prendre en charge leurs propres besoins ainsi que ceux de leurs familles.Le chef du groupe ( l'homme qui a le foulard blanc) est père de quatre enfants.Il exercent l'activité d'élevage depuis quelques années. Afin de faire une nouvelle opération, le groupe sollicite un pret de 600 000f pour acheter des boeufs.Ses membres ambitionnent d'étendre leur capacité d'embouche.
texts.en:
Mbelayiif is a mixed group with six members, two of whom are female. All of the group members are married, and each year they buy cattle which they fatten and resell on the market, in order to obtain more income. This business allows them to better provide for themselves and for their families. The head of the group (the man in the white scarf) is a father to four children. He has worked in this cattle-raising business for several years.

In order to carry out a new transaction, the group has requested a loan of 600,000 francs to buy cattle. The group members plan to expand their cattle-raising capacity.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Marianit

texts.en:
Marianit is married, with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marianit is 31 years old.

Marianit has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marianit requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fishing net and other fishing paraphernalia.

Marianit has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Marianit would like to save enough money, so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing paraphernalia.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
Evelia tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos (dos mujeres y dos hombres). Cuenta con tres años y meses de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tortillas en un puesto de venta ubicado en la acera cerca del mercado de la comunidad. Antes ella trabajo en PROCAFE, luego con UNE durante ocho años. Hoy en día vende sus tortillas y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de estructuras metálicas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar repollo, salsas, verduras, para elaborar pupusas ya que en el mes de febrero son las fiestas patronales en su pueblo. Así, ella instalara la pupusería, para obtener un ingreso más para sostenimiento de su familia y con las ganancias poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Evelia is thirty-seven years old, is married, and has four children (two girls and two boys).  She has been working in making and selling tortillas for three years and some months, at a locale located on the sidewalk close to the community market.  Before, she worked at PROCAFE, and then with UNE for eight years.  Today, she sells her tortillas and her husband makes a living in metal structures work.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy cabbage, sauce, and vegetables in order to make her stuffed tortillas.  In the month of February, the feast days for the patron saint of her town are celebrated.  Therefore, she will set up her tortilla stand in order to obtain higher revenue so that she can sustain her family.  With the profits, she also will be able to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, sauce, and vegetables to make stuffed tortillas.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años de edad, tiene cinco hijos, su compañero de vida vive en otro país. Tiene 26 años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de empanadas y tortillas. Las empanadas las sale a vender de manera ambulante en el lugar en donde vive, las tortillas las vende en su casa. Aprendió el negocio por iniciativa propia, en vista de la necesidad de obtener ingresos para la familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar maíz, plátanos, entre otros insumos para su negocio. Su propósito, es hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is forty-eight years old, has five children, and her life partner lives in another country.  For twenty-six years, she has been dedicating herself to the making and selling of empanadas and tortillas.  She leaves in the morning to sell the empanadas by walking door to door in the area where she lives.  She sells the tortillas from her home.  She learned this business through her own initiative after realizing the need to have an income for her family.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy corn, plantains, and other ingredients for her business.  Her intention is to make her business grow and to better the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, plantains, and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Bill

texts.es:
Bill tiene 18 años y a su corta edad ha logrado ser padre de su pequeña Jazmín de 1 añito, junto a el su compañera de vida Yuliza de 18 años tiene la gran misión de sacar adelante a su familia.
Reside en una vivienda construida a base de adobe que fue cedido por sus padres. Desde niño fue siempre participe en las diversas labores concernientes a la producción de cacao orgánico.
Lleva 3 años a cargo de una parcela que fue heredado por sus padres y con el cual se encuentra realizando el mantenimiento respectivo de los árboles cacaoteros, esperando a fin de temporada contar con buena producción  y obtener un precio justo por parte de los acopiadores de la zona.
A manera de mantener el trabajo uniforme, planea realizar la plantación de árboles para que proporcionen sombra permanente indispensables para las plantas pequeñas y obtengan una buena calidad.
Paralelo a dichas actividades desea también contar con personal de apoyo para llevar a cabo el primer deshierbo de maleza.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a la apertura de un negocio consistente en una tienda de abarrotes con el cual espera ocupar laboralmente a Yuliza. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente muy contento por la confianza brindada la cual espera agradecer con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
Requiere en esta primera ocasión contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para contratar jornaleros y hacer el deshierbo de maleza, asimismo sembrar árboles.
texts.en:
Bill is 18-years old, and at his young age he has already become the father of his little 1-year old Jazmín.  Together with his life partner, 18-year old Yuliza, he has the great mission of helping his family to get ahead.  
Bill lives in an adobe home that was given to him by his parents.  Since he was a boy, Bill has participated in various jobs related to the production of organic cacao. 
For the last three years, Bill has had the responsibility for a plot of land that was inherited from his parents.  On it, he is maintaining cacao trees and hoping that at the end of the season he will have a good yield and get a fair price from the gatherers in the area. 
To keep his work uniform, he plans to plant trees to provide permanent and essential shade for the small plants so they can reach a good quality. 
Along with the above activities, Bill wants some personal help to carry out the first weeding.
His future plans point toward opening a business along the lines of a grocery store, in which Yuliza would work.  This is Bill's first loan with MFP.  He feels very happy about the confidence they have placed in him.  He hopes to show his thanks by punctually repaying his loan.
He needs a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles ($400 USD) at this time to hire day laborers to do the weeding and also to plant trees.

loans.use: hire day laborers.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada muy dedicada a sus labores del hogar como a sus actividades en el campo con su esposo y sus 5 hijos, juntos se dedican a la agricultura cultivan maíz, frijoles y también hacen viveros de café el cual es comercializado en la zona donde habitan, ella no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar por la falta de recursos económicos pero aprendió a firmar. En compañía de su esposo se dedican a la actividad de elaboración de viveros hace más de 7 años, después que su esposo sufriera un accidente automovilístico en el cual le amputaron su pierna derecha debido a este problema se le dificulta realizar las actividades a tiempo completo por lo cual sus hijos y esposa implementaron esta nueva actividad.

Antonia hoy en día solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes y bombas de riego para el cultivo y vivero de café ya que es muy sensible y fácil de contaminar con la enfermedad de la roya y el costo de este fertilizante es un poco elevado por lo tanto se le dificulta la compra del mismo para mantener sano su cultivo y vivero.

Su meta es poder obtener mejores ganancia para seguir apoyando su sueño y el sueño de sus hijos verlos estudiando diariamente y en un futuro graduados con carreras que les permitan tener mejores oportunidades de empleo, un mejor estilo de vida, ya que el trabajo de la tierra es muy pesado y las ganancias son pocas.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 38 year old woman, and she is married.  She is very devoted to her household chores as she is to her business activities in the field with her husband and five children.  Together they grow corn and beans.  They also have a coffee nursery, which is sold in the area where they live.

She did not have the chance to go to school due to the lack of financial resources.  However, she learned to sign.  She and her husband have been developing coffee nurseries for over seven years.  After her husband had an automobile accident they amputated his right leg.  Due to this problem, it is difficult to for him to do these business activities full time.  Therefore, their children and his wife started this new business activity.

Antonia is now requesting help to buy fertilizers and irrigation pumps for the crops and the coffee nursery.  They are very susceptible to and easily contract  rust disease.  The cost of this fertilizer is a bit high.  Therefore, it is difficult for her to buy it in order to keep her crop and her nursery healthy.

Her goal is to be able to get better income in order to continue supporting her dream and her children's dream.  The dream is to see her children going to school every day.  Her dream is to see them, in the future, graduate with careers that would allow them to have better job opportunities and a better lifestyle.  This is because working with the land is very difficult and the profits are small.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and irrigation pumps for her corn and bean crops and her coffee nursery.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Nicolasa esta casada, tiene 45 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos quienes están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inicio este trabajo gracias al apoyo de su papá que la llevo a un negocio para que trabajara y aprendiera este trabajo, hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuentan con el apoyo de su esposo quien realiza el mismo trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de materiales, específicamente la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y clases, espera seguir mejorando su producción y estar con los diseños actuales. Espera en el futuro contar con empleados y que sus hijos aprendan este trabajo.
texts.en:
María Nicolasa, 45, is married and has six children in school.  She didn't have the opportunity to study.

She makes a living weaving traditional skirts.  She started this business thanks to the support of her father, who took her to a business to work and learn this job.  She currently has six years of experience.  She has the support of her husband, who does the same work.

She's requesting a loan to buy materials, specifically different colors and types of thread.

She hopes to continue improving her production and work with current designs.  She hopes to have employees in the future and for her children to learn this work.

loans.use: to buy thread to weave skirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is 51 years old. She has a piggery business. Over the three years of operating her business, she earns about PHP 5,000, which is not enough to sustain allowances, electric bills, and food for a month. 

Remelyn wants to increase her capacity of sales, therefore, she needs to avail herself of a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and an additional two pigs. She hopes this loan will contribute to the success of her business in order to further develop her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and an additional two pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion is 40 years old, and is busy managing her general store business. She has been in this business for seven years and earns a minimum of PHP 300 a day. Visitacion is married to a farmer who helps her raise their children. At this time, Visitacion wants to expand her business. In this regard, she is taking out this loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, assorted breads and condiments to sell. Visitacion hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, assorted breads and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela works hard to support her family. Angela is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Angela requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, can goods, spices, eggs, etc.
Angela has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, can goods, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is married and is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marissa has been in this business for five years. Marissa earns additional income from clothing sales.
Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 51 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like snack foods, bread, candies, soft drinks, etc.

Elisa has been in this business for 10 years.
In the future Elisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like snack foods, bread, candies, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en: Ferdinand works hard to fulfill the needs of his family as well as his educational obligations for his children. He hopes his children are able to finish their education and become successful someday.  This will help to lift their living condition. But at this moment, he is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to use in the repair and maintenance of his multicab that travels between Camalaniugan and Aparri. He knows that with hard work he will soon achieve a better income.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his multicab.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: La señora Rosa, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo e hijos, ella sueña con tener un hogar digno y que su economia se mejor, ella tiene un negocio donde vende abarrotes, Refrescos etc. con este nuevo credito ella podra ampliar sus productos para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ademas vende comida por las tardes. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic le ha brindado y Fondos Kiva
texts.en: Sra. Rosa lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband and children. She dreams of having a decent home and that her finances will improve. She has a business where she sells groceries, soft drinks, etc.  With this new loan she will be able to expand her inventory in order to satisfy her customers’ demands. In addition to her grocery business, she also sells meals in the afternoons. She is grateful for the support Afodenic has provided to her and for Kiva funding.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Johany Evgeling

texts.es: La señora Johany habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo ella trabaja como modista, tiene su propio taller hubicado en su casa, y su esposa labora para una empresa privada, con este nuevo credito comprara Materia Prima como : Telas, Hilos, Helasticos, Tijeras etc. Agradece el apoyo que afodenic le esta brindado con su negocio ya que esto le trae muchos ingresos y mejora en su hogar
texts.en: Sra. Johany lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband. She works as a seamstress and has her own workshop at her house. Her husband works for a private company. With this new loan, she will buy basic supplies, such as fabric, thread, elastic, scissors, etc. She is grateful for the help Afodenic is providing to her business because it enables her to earn more income and improve her household.

loans.use: to purchase basic supplies.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en: Gulnoza is a smart girl. She is 21 years old. Gulnoza is not married and lives with her parents. She graduated school with excellent marks and 3 years ago entered the Pedagogical University of Tajikistan. Now, she is a 3rd year student. She is a good student and always takes part in all aspects of university life. Also, she works after her classes at the computer center. She makes copies, prints documents and other services. She earns 400 somoni every month. She uses her money for her daily needs and has not been able to save enough for paying tuition. She is asking for a loan to pay her tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 60 years old and married, with eight children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elsie is borrowing PHP 19,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elsie has been raising pigs for 12 years and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell rice grains. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer to use for school work.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita buys and sells fruits and vegetables to help her husband support their family. She aims to improve the business and make it profitable in order to generate sufficient income. To this end, she plans to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell. 

Clarita is asking for additional capital of 5,000 PHP to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, beans, cabbages, and onions to sell. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she has the determination to improve the business. She hopes that someday she will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, beans, cabbages, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie, 49, wants to earn enough money to support her seven children. Her eagerness to provide a better income for her family motivates her request for additional working capital of 5,000 PHP. 

Jose will use the loan to buy Avon and MSE products to fulfill the orders of her loyal customers. She hopes this financial assistance will allow her to offer better services and to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy Avon and MSE products for sale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La señora Ana, una mujer sencilla, trabajadora desde  muy joven, habitante del municipio de San Ignacio, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos tengan un mayor porvenir, ella cultiva Cafe y su dificultad es que por el clima y las plagas su cosecha se puedan perder, con este nuevo credito que se le ha otorgado comprara los insumos y fertilizantes necesario para darle Mantenimiento a sus plantas de Cafe. Agradece la confianza que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Ana is a simple woman, who has been working hard since she was very young. She lives in the municipality of San Ignacio. Her greatest dream is that her children will have a better future. She is a coffee farmer; her biggest challenges with her work are the climate and pests because they can cause her to lose her crop. With this new loan she is requesting she will buy necessary supplies and fertilizers to provide upkeep to her coffee plants. She is pleased that Afodenic and Kiva funds  consider her trustworthy enough for a loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies for the maintenance of her coffee crop.

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie, 42, is a single mother with one child. For almost ten years, she has owned and operated a vegetable vending business; she also sells some condiments for additional income. She earns a net income of 15,000 PHP a month. 

Emilie is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase cabbage, sweet potatoes, onion, ginger, and garlic to sell at the public market. Her profits usually go to her daily expenditures and to her child's school costs.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage, sweet potatoes, onion, ginger, and garlic for sale.

loans.name: Nelly Kati

texts.es: Ella es Nelly una madre trabajadora  de 40 años separada con 02 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 01 de ellos. Con los deseos de mejorar y de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia Nelly decide emprender su propio negocio, donde actualmente se dedica a la venta de comida  la cual lo realiza a reparto. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido  terminar de construir su vivienda. Su mayor anhelo es seguir mejorando su negocio, pues así podrá sacar adelante a su menor hija.  Solicitó el crédito  para invertir en su negocio la cual comprará ollas grandes donde le permita preparar sus comidas con más comodidad. Nelly agradece a los personas que hicieron posible este crédito.
texts.en:
Nelly is a hard working mother who is 40 years old. She is separated and has two children. She is currently supporting one of them. With the goal of improving her family’s quality of life, Nelly decided to start her own business and now sells and delivers meals. Thanks to her effort she has been able to finish construction on her dwelling.

Her greatest desire is to continue improving her business so that she can help her younger daughter get ahead. She requested the loan to invest in her business and will buy large pots which will enable her to prepare her meals more efficiently. Nelly is grateful to the people who made this loan possible.

loans.use: to purchase cooking pots.

loans.name: 126 Grace Group

texts.en:
"126 Grace" is a group of six people whose members live in the same village and work in different fields. The profiled member, Sri, is pictured here with her hand raised. She is 33 years old and a mother to a son and a married daughter. Both of her children attend a state school nearby. 

Sri sells fried snacks, such as sausage spring rolls, at a private school near her house. She started this business four years ago, and it is going very well; she earns up to 150,000 IDR a day. 

Sri will use this loan to buy a stove and purchase additional ingredients like sausage, spring rolls, corn, and chicken. Sri enjoys her work because cooking is her hobby.

Sri and the other members of the "126 Grace" group are requesting financial support from VisionFund Indonesia for the third time so that they can increase their working capital. Sri hopes one day to send her child to school in Saudi Arabia.

loans.use: to buy a stove and food stuffs.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 49 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

For ten years, Alicia has operated a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients.

In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 42 years old and is married, with three school-aged children. To make a living, Jimmy raises hogs. He has been in this business for three years. He earns PHP 2,500 per piglet sold.

Jimmy wants to have more hogs to raise, but he lacks the necessary capital. Therefore, he is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy additional hogs and feed. He hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs and feed.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 36 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

For 12 years, Gina has operated a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, soap, noodles, and eggs to sell.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 45-year-old single mother of two chdilren, both of whom attend school. She also takes care of one orphan boy: he lives with Margret, and she pays his school fees and feeds him on the little income she generates from her retail shop.

Margret started her shop two years ago as a source of income after she was divorced by her husband. She needed to find a means of survival for her children since the bread winner had left them for another woman. Margret is a hard working and ambitious woman.

Margret hopes to expand into wholesale business to increase her income and better provide for her children. Her major challenge is an under-stocked shop. This discourages customers who ask for products she does not have, and she sometimes loses them to her immediate competitors. The loan will help her to improve the variety of products she offers and thus retain her customers.

loans.use: to stock her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maintenance supplies for farming

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
This is Angelyn, 25, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Diosdado, a vendor, with whom she has one child. Together, Angelyn and her husband work hard for a secure future for their family.

Angelyn sells diesel fuel. Instead of going to the gasoline station where fuel is more expensive, drivers can just buy diesel from her with less hassle at a cheaper price. She earns a minimum of 40,000 PHP every week.

To help her continue her business operations, Angelyn is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more diesel from her supplier. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Angelyn hopes that her business will continue to be successful, and she hopes to have a good life. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories about her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy diesel for sale.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, 60 years old, is married to a fisherman and blessed with six children. They are currently living in a small village in the Reussey Keo district of Phnom Penh.  

For almost ten years, Sok has worked as a mobile vendor selling bread. Every day, she gets up early to fill her basket with bread and start her business day by selling her product around her neighborhood. She earns a net profit of about 5 USD a day, while her husband makes 2 USD a day as a fisherman. 

Sok would like to acquire a loan in the amount of 600 USD through HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase construction supplies needed for home improvements. She will also use a small portion of the loan for her retail business. She hopes that the loan will be granted to her so that she can improve her income and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies needed for home improvements.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia de 38 años es una madre digna y de mucha responsabilidad laboral, comparte una vida conyugal con Jacinto de 34 años y para complemento de su alegría familiar tiene el orgullo de ser madre de 3 menores hijos como son Elizabeth , Ruth y Jhon.
Comparte sus vivencias familiares en una vivienda construida  a base de material noble que viene construyendo de a pocos. Es productora de cacao orgánico, actividad que realiza con mucho entusiasmo puesto que para ella es seguir la tradición familiar cultivada desde tiempos atras.
Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus parcelas con el apoyo de jacinto su esposo y algunos jornaleros de la zona para trabajar en el mantenimiento técnico adecuado de sus plantaciones de cacao. tanto el deshierbo de maleza, como la fertilización son indispensables para obtener una producción de calidad.
Actualmente sus terrenos de cultivos presentan cierto déficit en cuanto a los nutrientes necesarios para sus plantaciones, es por ello que desea contar con su entidad financiera para la compra de sacos con abono orgánico.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a la compra de mas parcelas de cultivo para extender su producción, de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos a largo plazo. Este es su primero préstamo con MFP, agradecida por la primera oportunidad espera seguir trabajando de manera firme y cumplir siempre de manera puntual con el pago de sus cuotas para acceder a un crédito mayor en adelante. Requiere contar en esta primera oportunidad con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de sacos con abono orgánico para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a 38-year old respectable mother with a high degree of work responsibility. She shares her life with Jacinto (34 years old) and is a proud mother of three minor children, named Elizabeth, Ruth and Jhon. They live in a house made of fine materials that has been built little by little. 

She works in the production of organic cocoa, an activity that she performs with enthusiasm following a long family tradition. Every morning she goes to her plots and, with the support of her husband Jacinto and some day laborers in the area, works for the appropriate technical maintenance of her plantations. Both the removal of weeds and the fertilization are essential to obtain high-quality products, but her plots currently show a nutrient deficiency, which is why she wants to count on her financial entity to buy organic fertilizer. 

In the future, she plans to buy more plots to expand her production and, in the long run, to increase her income. This is her first loan with MFP and, thankful for this first opportunity, she expects to continue working steadily and to punctually comply with her payments with an aim to have access to a larger loan some day. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy bags of organic fertilizer to improve her production.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase juice, soda, water and gatorade.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married to Moses together with whom they have four children who are all of school-going age. When Sarah got married, her husband was the only bread winner for the family and eventually the family had their third child. The income her husband was earning at the time was not enough to sustain the growing family in terms of both upkeep and school fees for the children because she was just a housewife. Their children would be sent away from school due to delayed school fees payments.

She then thought of starting an income generating venture to help the husband meet family costs. At that time (2004) there was a problem of water in the area where they reside. Tap water was in the neighborhood but a majority of the people, including her, could not afford to buy it. She thus saw an opportunity in it and reached the water supply authority who granted her a tap in her compound on an agreement that she keeps remitting a rental fee and also paying monthly  bills .

She then started selling the water to neighbors at a lower price. As a result,she attracted  a huge market and she now has that as an additional source of income for the family. 

Sarah would like this loan for paying tuition for has children who have reported back to school.

In the photograph, Sarah appears with her husband and their daughter at their tap.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Kitintale Devt Group

texts.en:
The group is committed to support each other out of poverty.The stories belong to two people Prossy and sylivia who  have two different kinds of businesses.

Prossy is married with 4 children. She sells fruits and vegetables in a relatively busy trading centre. She does the business to meet the needs of the family. She works hard to recover profits from the fruits, which are quite expensive and perishable, so she has to keep them under favorable conditions so that they do not go bad. She has managed to establish a good foundation for the children through educating them, as well as providing for their basic needs.

Sylivia, another group member, sells sweaters and uniforms to sell to some schools. The loan will help her overcome the challenge of limited capital and also help her to deliver her products in time. She is grateful to the group members for their continuous advice and encouragement in helping her to go on, even when times seem hard.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables and also buy threads for sewing sweaters.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania de 52 años casada con Paulino de 58 años tiene el orgullo de haber brindado lo mejor de si a sus hijos quienes hoy ya mayores son personas responsables y trabajadoras.
Posee una vivienda construida a base de adobe. Desde muy joven se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico y barbasco.
Desempeña sus labores en una parcela que fue adquirió hace 35 años por parte de sus padres. Sus labores normalmente convocan a jornaleros debido a ser considerable el tamaño de sus plantaciones.
Le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que es una actividad que desempeño casi toda su vida y se siente digna de desempeñar la labor que caracteriza a su familia.
Como la temporada de lluvias es constante en esta época del año desea contar con capital para proceder con el abono de sus árboles puesto que la tierra húmeda facilita la asimilación de los nutrientes que posee el abono orgánico.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble.
Este es su primer crédito con MFP, agradecida por la oportunidad se muestra muy contenta y comprometida con su labor.
Requiere contar en esta primera ocasión con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de sacos abono orgánico y proceder aplicarlos a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Epifania is fifty-two years old and is married to Paulino, who is fifty-eight years old.  She has the pride of having offered the best to her children, who are now older and are responsible and hardworking people.  She has a home made of adobe.  

Since she was very young, she has made a living in the production of organic cacao and evergreen plants.  She carries out her work on a plot of land that she acquired thirty-five years ago from her parents.  Her work normally necessitates hiring day laborers, since her plantations are of a considerable size.

Her job very much pleases her; it is an activity that she has performed nearly her entire life and she feels worthy of carrying out the work of her family.

Since the rainy weather is constant in this time of year, she hopes to have capital so that she can proceed in applying the fertilizer to her trees.  The humid earth facilitates the absorption of the nutrients that the organic fertilizer possesses.  

Her future plans include building her home from a more noble material.  This is her first loan with MFP, and she is thankful for the opportunity.  She is very happy and committed to her work.

She requires this first loan of 1,000 soles to buy sacks of organic fertilizer, so that she can then proceed in applying it to her cacao plantations.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: care for his crops.

loans.name: Eriya

texts.en:
Eriya is 37 years old, married and with three children who are all school-going. He is a motorcyclist, a business he is operating as a major source of income. In addition to that, Eriya operates a video cinema hall and does phone charging to get additional income to cater for the family. He started all this after dropping out of school because his parents failed to raise tuition fees.

He wants a loan of 500,000 (five hundred thousand shillings) to buy a small solar system to boost his business because they have a challenge of electricity in their village. He hopes by expanding the business, he will be in position to improve the living standards of the family and also put up a permanent residential house and pay tuition for his children.

Eriya is a hardworking man and hope that very soon he will get other loan products like school fees because he always has difficulty with raising the money. In the photo is Eriya with a Ugafode credit officer who had gone to appraise him.

loans.use: To buy a solar system.

loans.name: Kasojo Farmers Savings & Credit Group

texts.en:
Obadia raising up the hand is 24 years old and married with two children who have started schooling.  He is also taking care of two orphans: a two year old and a four year old.

Obadia buys and sells cereals. He has a corn milling machine. He started this business in 2005 with an aim of increasing his daily family income.

Obadia wants a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy more cereals. He buys the cereals and mills them. He hopes to expand his business by buying a motor vehicle to transport the corn flour from the village to the market.

His major challenge is the limited capital he has for his business. He also has difficulty getting vehicles to transport both the corn and the flour. He commends the lender for the efficient and timely provision of their services.
Attached is a photo of the group members, they are 15 because the local council chairperson who did not acquire a loan this cycle agreed to be part of the photo, he signed the waiver though.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fruits and vegetables retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from abaca-making. 

Beatriz is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Beatriz has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Oscar Vicente

texts.es: El señor Oscar, habita en el municipio de Nindiri, su esposa una mujer humilde y trabajadora entre los dos han sacado adelante a sus hijos, con este nuevo credito que se le ha otorgado comprar lo siguiente: Completo, Urea, Triple, Fertilizantes etc. Agradece el apoyo de Afodenic y Fondos Kivas quienes durante estos años le han brindado.
texts.en: Mister Oscar lives in the municipality of Nindiri. His wife is a modest and hard working woman and between the two of them, they have given their children opportunities to get ahead in life. With this new loan, they will purchase the following: Fertilizers (like Completo, Triple, urea and others). He thanks Afodenic and Kiva for the support they have shown him in the past few years.

loans.use: care for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete building  her rental houses.

loans.name: Mackays Group

texts.en:
Javan’s group is comprised of 10 farmers and is located in Kakamega South District.  Javan is pictured amongst the 5 men and 5 women of his group.  He is the individual with his hand raised in the photograph.  

Javan will receive input loans that will allow him to plant ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize.  Javan first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season.  Javan joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for his family and use his increased profits to send his children to school.  As a One Acre Fund farmer, Javan had a very good harvest last year.  He hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season.  He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and pay debts.  

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit.  Javan’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Lukusi Group

texts.en:
Lukusi is a group of 10 farmers in Bungoma South District represented by Joel. The group has 5 women and 5 men. Joel is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Joel joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2009, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Joel joined One Acre Fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and their good trainings.

Joel described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and perhaps invest in another business. Joel’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old and is married to Lillian. They have four children: two of them are studying at university and the other two are at secondary level. 

In addition, John takes care of two dependants because their parents lack the capacity to look after them. He pays their tuition and caters for all their basic needs out of the little income that he generates from his business.

He started a retail shop in 1996 as a source of income to support his family and educate his children. He has managed the business for such a long time because of his good customer care and service, and the quality products he sells to them.

He has a dream of expanding his business through opening up other outlets so as to increase on his income. He hopes to see that his children get quality education as well as the dependants. His major challenges are inadequate capital and income for the family. He is the sole provider in the family as his wife is unemployed. 

John's neighbours comment that he is a very hardworking, determined and is a dedicated ambitious businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 40 years old, married, with two children and lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is very hard-working and is always sure to meet her targets.

She owns a general shop where she sells basic commodities, such as milk, eggs, soft drinks, flour, and bread. She also sells perfumes, utensils, and creams. She has been doing this for the last four years, hence, she has improved customer relations. She has now gained a wide popularity in the markets and, therefore, she needs to expand.

Fatuma is approaching us with a loan request amounting to KES 50,000 to stock her shop with sacks of both wheat and maize flour, sacks of sugar, and utensils.

loans.use: to stock her shop with sacks of both wheat and maize flour, sacks of sugar, and utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay the remaining installments for an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 31 years old and is a business woman.  She is married to her husband, Bonventure.  They are blessed with two children.  

Rebecca has been running a greengrocer store for the past six years.  She earns a monthly income of KES 10,500, which she uses to support her family. 
Rebecca is applying for her second loan term with KADET LTD after successfully repaying her first loan.  She will use the loan to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes for her grocery shore. 

She plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to educate her children.  She hopes and dreams of improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes for her grocery shore.

loans.name: Paulo Juan

texts.es:
El señor Paulo Juan esta casado, tiene 41 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando en primaria y educacion media, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos,  inicio este negocio contando con un solo telar, hasta el momento lleva 11 años de experiencia y ya tiene otros  telares, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quienes dedica al mismo trabajo.

Solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos y un rollo de labores con diseños, esto con el fin de producir mas tejidos y mejorar sus ventas, Espera seguir mejorando su negocio y mas adelantes tener nuevos diseños.
texts.en:
Paulo Juan is married, he is 41 years old, he completed third grade and he has 6 children, 3 of whom are studying at primary and middle school. He weaves traditional fabrics. He started this business relying on just one loom. So far he has 11 years of experience and he now has other looms. He relies on the support of his wife who works doing the same thing.

He is applying for a loan which he will use to buy thread and a reel of fabric decorations with designs, for the purpose of producing more fabric and improving his sales. He hopes to keep improving his business and later on have new designs.

loans.use: To buy thread and fabric decorations.

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en:
Shafiga is a 61-year-old, friendly, hard-working woman.  She and her husband receive a retirement pension.  They have a 20-year-old child living with them.  Shafiga has been involved in agricultural for more than 21 years.  This business has always helped to support stable living conditions for the family.  Because her husband has always helped her, she is able to increase the number of animals she manages.  

Today she has two cows, one head of cattle, and one calf on her farm.  Shafiga sells milk products and fattens animals.  Her loan request is to buy a cow to fatten and resell.

loans.use: to buy a cow to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
This is Esperanza, 48, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is single and she manages the household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Esperanza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Esperanza  earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Esperanza is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion in her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Esperanza dreams to have a good life and that she would grow more in God. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Cristina esta casada tiene 31 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 esta estudiando, se dedica al tejido de cortes y al bordado de blusas típicas, negocio que inicio con pequeños trabajos, lo cual le ha generado ganancias, ya hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la tejeduría.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas, forros e hilos para mejorar su produccion de bordados, ya que quiere tener un negocio estable y son venta activa, esperando el el futuro contar con un grupo de señora trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Cristina is 31 years of age and is married. She studied six years of elementary school and has two children, one of whom is a student. She works in the weaving and embroidery of traditional cloth and blouses, a business which she started off by taking on small jobs. This generated income for her, and she now has 10 years of experience. She has the support of her husband, who is also a weaver.

Rosa Cristina has requested a loan which she will use to buy fabrics, lining and thread to improve her embroidery production. She wants to have a stable business and these products sell well, and she hopes that in the future she will be able to have a group of women working with her in her business.

loans.use: To buy embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 57 years old and lives in the Telavi district with his wife. The only income provider for the family is Teimuraz’s wife, working as an accountant. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

 Teimuraz has decided to start a new business to supplement his income but his loan requests have been rejected several times by local financial institutions. He lacks experience with new business start-ups and does not qualify under income requirements. 

Teimuraz is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to many credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Teimuraz will use his loan to start a car wash. He will purchase essential equipment and a vacuum cleaner. Teimuraz will provide services to local community members and hopes to increase the monthly income of the family. His new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to start up a car wash

loans.name: Urozali

texts.ru: Урозали 42 года. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Старший сын находится в загранице на заработках. Урозали обеспечивает семью от купле-продажи скота. Он занимается животноводством уже 4 года. Урозали просит кредит для закупа коз и овец. Он будет откармливать скот и затем продаст их с наценкой. На полученную прибыль он хочет купить свадебное приданое для дочери и выдать ее замуж.
texts.en: Urozali is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. His eldest son is working abroad. Urozali provides for his family by buying and selling livestock. He has been involved in animal husbandry for four years. Urozali is asking for a loan to purchase goats and sheep. He will fatten the livestock and then sell them at a premium. With the profits he makes, he wants to purchase a wedding dowry for his daughter and marry her off.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es:
Adrian de 43  años de edad, originario de Granada, acompañado, padre de 4 hijos entre las edades de 3, 14, 18 y 20 años respectivamente, actualmente solo uno esta estudiando y los otros tres trabajan, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de calzado desde muy joven, su nivel académico es hasta el segundo año de secundaria. El inicio en el ámbito del comercio, trabajando como ayudante de su jefe, quien se dedicaba a la misma actividad, fue allí que adquirió experiencia y total dominio del negocio, ya que con ahorros propios decide establecer su propio negocio de taller de zapatería, el cual ha podido sacar adelante con apoyo de otras instituciones pero sobre todo con esfuerzo propio y arduo trabajo diario, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su compañera e hija, sus productos lo comercializa en Estelí y Chinandega, en donde cuenta con clientes fijos.

Requiere el financiamiento para comprar materia prima como cuero, pega, hilo, maquinas, etc. Todos  los materiales  necesarios para la elaboración de sus zapatos, el cual estima que este crédito le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá entregar sus trabajos en tiempos y forma, de esta manera poder ofrecer un productos de muy buena calidad para mayor satisfacción de los clientes, uno de sus planes futuros es ampliar el local del negocio, para incrementar sus ventas y asi obtener mejores ganancias, como meta próximas es comprar por mayor toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus zapatos.
texts.en:
43-year-old Adrian comes from Granada. He's in a common law marriage and has four children aged 3, 14, 18 and 20 years. Only one of them is currently in school; the other three are in the workforce. He's a seller by trade. He has been making and selling shoes ever since he was very young. He completed his education up to the second year of secondary school (equivalent to middle or junior high school). He got his start in this line of work as an assistant to his boss, who ran the same type of business. That was how he acquired experience and completely mastered the trade. By using his savings he decided to establish a business of his own, a shoemaking shop. That's how he has been able to get ahead, with support from other institutions but mostly through his own efforts and daily, hard work. He gets help from his life partner and his daughter in this business. He sells his products in Estelí and Chinandega, where he has regular customers.
He requests the loan in order to purchase raw materials such as leather, adhesive, thread, equipment, etc. - all of the supplies he needs to make his shoes. He reckons that the loan will be of great help, because he will be able to deliver his orders in a timely and adequate fashion. That way he'll be able to offer a very high quality product and keep his customers most satisfied. One of his goals for the future is to expand his business venue so that he can increase his sales and therefore improve his profits. His next goal is to buy wholesale supplies, all the ones he needs in order to make his shoes.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as leather, adhesive, thread, equipment, etc.

loans.name: Ramani

texts.en:
Ramani is a 38-year-old divorced lady living with her only daughter, who is in school. She manages a tailoring shop where she stitches dresses like salwars (traditional Indian dress), etc., for her customers who give orders for stitching. Few years back when she got divorced with her husband, she was burdened with responsibilities for her daughter, so she started a tailoring shop. She earns only 3,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from her business.

Ramani plans to purchase two new sewing machines, fabrics, threads, buttons, ribbons, needles, etc., so that she can enlarge her business and take orders from her customers in bulk. She also wants to hire a workforce for help in the business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase two sewing machines and fabrics and to hire some help. She wants her daughter to study in a good school and to save some money for her future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing two new sewing machines, fabrics, buttons, ribbons, etc., for her tailoring business

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Naseem, appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Randa is a 41-year-old married woman from Beit Hanoun, near Jabalia. She is a mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Randa's husband is employed, but he earns very low wages that barely cover the family's basic living expenses. 

As a result, Randa's husband started a motorcycle repair business to generate more income. He has been in this business for three years, but the business now needs more capital so that he can buy a new repair kit. Randa is therefore seeking a $1,500 loan from FATEN, which will help Randa's husband improve his business and hopefully make the business more profitable.

loans.use: to expand and improve the business by purchasing a new repair kit for the workshop

loans.name: Karama

texts.en:
Karama is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 10.  All of them go to school.
Karama runs a fruit and vegetable selling business and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1500 SSP to purchase dodo, okra, lemons, and many other items. She has no other source of income aside from this business.

In five years, Karama would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include the high prices in the market. Karama says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like dodo, okra, lemons, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 10.  All of them go to school.

Sarah runs a general store and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1000 SSP to purchase onions, beans, and many other items.  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years sarah would like to expand her   business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Sarah says she is happy with the loans given by Finance Sudan   through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like onions, beans, etc

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru:
Заявитель Айсулуу, 1969 года рождения, замужем, имеет троих детей, образование среднее.  В ведении хозяйства и бизнеса помогают муж и сын. 
За время оформления документов заемщик показал себя с положительной стороны, как человек ответственный и предприимчивый, умеющий правильно вести хозяйство и вкладывать средства по назначению, среди соседей и знакомых имеет авторитет, характеризуется как человек отзывчивый и доброжелательный. 
Свой бизнес заемщица начинала в 1990 году, с накопленных 4 000 KGS. Муж заемщицы является местным чабаном и занимается выпасом КРС местных жителей. В настоящее время Айсулуу в своем активе имеет 6 голов КРС. Имеются все условия для содержания скота. Кроме животноводства, заемщица занимается полеводством. На 1,15га земельного надела ежегодно выращивают хлопок. Свою деятельность осуществляет на основании своего многолетнего опыта, знает все тонкости в сфере животноводства и полеводства. Айсулуу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, семян и удобрений. За счет прибыли от проекта заемщик собирается отремонтировать свой дом и летнюю кухню.
texts.en:
Aisuluu, the applicant, was born in 1969, is married, and has three children.  She has a secondary education. Her husband and son help her with the household and business. 

While filling out the loan application, the borrower gave a very positive impression as someone who is responsible and enterprising, able to run a farm make investments properly. She is respected among her neighbors and friends, and has been described as someone who is sympathetic and friendly. 

She began her business in 1990 with 4,000 KGS. Her husband is a cattleman who grazes cattle for local residents. Currently, Aisuluu has six head of cattle. She has everything necessary to maintain the cattle properly. In addition to animal husbandry, she farms.  She has a 1.5 hectare plot of land where she grows cotton every year. She has many years of experience, and she knows the ins and outs of livestock care and farming. Aisuluu has asked Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 KGS to buy livestock, seed, and fertilizer. With the profit she earns from the loan, the borrower is going to renovate her house and summer kitchen.

loans.use: To purchase cattle, fertilizer, and seeds

loans.name: Kethegbeh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present the members of the “Kathegbeh” group. These are three small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,200,000 Leones for each in order to invest in their respective businesses.
 
Adama is the leader of this group. Adama is 40, married to a driver and has six children. Two of the children are in primary school and four in secondary school. Adama sells market food such as palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), pepper, onions, etc.  She has been doing this for many years. 

With the help of this loan, Adama will invest in her business by buying palm oil, pepper, onions, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, peppers, onions, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizers in order to maintain his crop.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 42 years old and is married. He and his wife are blessed with three children. 

Antonio is engaged in a hog-raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. He has three heads of sow. Sometimes he has difficulties in feeding his pigs, which is why he decided to request a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs. 

He hopes to maintain his business for the future of his family. He will manage his business well, and gain higher income to save some of it for their future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs

loans.name: Katerina

texts.ru: Катерина – из Ужгорода. Она уже много лет работает старшим оператором станционного технологического центра на Львовской железной дороге. Совсем недавно ее сын принял решение жениться. Катерина очень хочет помочь ему финансово. Она решила сделать свадебный подарок молодым и хотела бы приобрести для них спальню. Сумма в 5 000 гривен необходима ей именно для того, чтобы приобрести подарок сыну.
texts.en:
Katerina is from Uzhgorod. She has worked as the most senior cleaner at the station technological center of Lvov's railway for many years. 

Very recently her son made the decision to get married. Katerina would like to help him financially. She decided to give the young a wedding present and would like to purchase a bed for them. The amount of 5,000 hryvnia is necessary precisely in order to purchase the present for her son.

loans.use: to purchase a bed as a wedding present for her son

loans.name: Orozgul

texts.ru: Орозгул 58 лет, замужем, они с мужем воспитали 4 детей. Дети Орозгул взрослые две дочери не замужем живут с родителями. Орозгул с 1995 года начала заниматься животноводством, стартовав с 10,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Орозгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется очень развитое хозяйство, приносящее около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Орозгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма. Доходы от кредита Орозгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства. В ближайшем будущем собирается выдать замуж дочерей. Они у нее кстати близнецы.
texts.en: Orozgul is 58 years old, married, and she and her husband have raised four children. Orozgul's children are adults, but her two single daughters live with their parents.  In 1995, Orozgul began working in animal husbandry and started the business with 10,000 KGS.  Thanks to Orozgul's hard work, her farm is now highly developed and brings in about 10,000 KGS per month. In order to further expand her business, Orozgul turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy cattle for fattening. With the income from the loan, Orozgul plans to invest in further expanding her farm. In the near future she plans to marry off her daughters who are, by the way, twins.

loans.use: purchase a cow and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sodikboy

texts.ru:
Содикбой, мужчина в возрасте 51 года, родился в сельской местности в семье рабочих.  Женат и имеет 2 детей. Жена Содикбоя нигде не работает , так как не имеет высшего образования.   Она занимается воспитание детей. Содикбою очень тяжело , так как он единственный кормилец в семье.
 Работает Содикчон  у себя в мастерской, занимается ремонтом холодильников, кондиционеров, пылесосов и других электроприборов. Он имеет огромное количество клиентов в своем селе.  Мастерская Содикбойя в очень плохом состоянии и нуждается в ремонте.  Он работает в плохих условиях.   
По совету знакомых Содикбой решил подать заявку и получить кредит. На полученный кредит он планирует купить строительные материалы и  отремонтировать свою мастерскую.  Содикбой заранее благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Sodikboy is a man of the age of 51 years. He was born on the countryside in a blue collar family. He is married and has two children. Sodikboy's wife does not work anywhere, as she does not have high school education. She is engaged in raising the children. It is very tough for Sodikboy, as he is the only provider for the family.

Sodikboy works in his own studio, repairing fridges, air conditioners, vacuum cleaners and other electronic devices. He has a large number of clients in his village. Sodikboy's studio is in a very poor state, and is in need of repair. He works under bad conditions. 

At the advice of an acquaintance, Sodikboy decided to apply for and receive a loan. For the loan received, he plans to invest in building materials and repair his studio. Sodikboy thanks the Kiva organization in advance for the financial support and help.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a rice buying and selling business in the Philippines. She has been doing this for nine years.

Helen requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 45 years old, married with six children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business over 10 years.  Each month, she earns 1,500 PHP doing this type of business. She joined GDMPC since year 2010. She requested a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure . In the future, she wants to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure
