This will be Fatima's second loan cycle from Al Mjamoua, her previous loan was invested in supporting her business too.
Most of her customers are her neighbors, friends and relatives. She is dreaming of opening a big shop in the near future and expanding her business to attract more customers.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of beauty products and creams.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her food production business. Teresita is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy meats, pigs and chicken to sell in her stall for her butcher shop business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy meats, pigs and chicken to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Sang'alo I Group

texts.en:
Sang'alo I is a group of 11 farmers in Bungoma South District, represented by Christine. The group has 8 women and 3 men. Christine is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Christine first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Christine joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and benefit from the group work and agricultural trainings offered by One Acre Fund.

Christine reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 2 bags of maize per 1 1/4 acres, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during the Long Rains of 2012, she harvested 9 bags per 1/2 acre! Christine described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. Christine’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 5.5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of 1/2 acre of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 100 kg of rice, 50 kg of wheat flour, 50 kg of sugar, 1 box of water cups, 2 boxes of instant noodles and more snacks.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 46 years old, married and blessed with two children. They are currently residing at the village of Namnama. She owns and operates a vegetable vending business where she sells cabbage, eggplant, tomatoes, squash, and string beans. Daisy has been in this business for almost 10 years, she's earning a net income of PHP 10,000 a month. 

She would like to acquire a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase vegetables to sell. According to her she also sells grocery items for additional income. Daisy hopes to have her loan granted, so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
This is Dominga. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more eggs which meant bigger income. She has been in this business for 23 years now, and this has helped her family a lot in terms of finances. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy raw materials in making salted eggs and of course to buy more eggs. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dominga hopes that her business will continue to grow and that it won't become bankrupt. She dreams for a loving and peaceful family. Every week she faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.*
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials and supplies needed in producing salted eggs.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 26-year-old from Nyahururu and is married with a daughter who is three years old.

Patrick has a welding business that he has been doing for the past four years and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more metal for his welding business.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy metals to use in his welding business.

loans.name: Yves

texts.fr: Mr Yves vit avec sa femme revendeuse et leur enfant à Lomé. Âgé de 34ans, il exerce comme activité la vente d’habits pour hommes dans une boutique louée pour cet effet. Avec la qualité de ses marchandises, il a de nombreux clients de parts et d’autres de la ville de Lomé c’est pour cela il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises.  Comme perspectives d’avenir, Yves veut renforcer son activité  et voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en: Mr Yves lives with his wife, who is a re-seller of clothes, and their child in Lomé. His commercial activity is to sell men's clothes in a boutique that is rented for this type of business. The quality of his merchandise is apparent to the lqrge number of customers he has who come from various neighborhood in Lomé. He is asking for a loan in order to purchase larger quantities of clothing. He hopes to continue to grow his business and enable his family to be fulfilled.

loans.use: purchase clothing

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
This is Marcelina. She previously accessed a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan, which she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more gardening materials, such as wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer. The profits from her business will definitely help her provide for her family's daily needs. She is looking forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marcelina hopes that her business will keep on growing and dreams that her family will have a good and peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening supplies and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a 62-year-old married woman and a mother of five grown-up children from Bohol in the Philippines. She has a fishing business and also has been running a sari-sari or variety store for several years now. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

Cresencia is asking for a loan to buy additional stock for her store, such as canned goods, rice, soda, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to cater for more buyers in her store, thus improving her sales and income. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money so that she can repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store, such as canned goods, rice, soda, soap, toiletries and others

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is 44 years old, married and is gifted with six children. She runs a small variety store in her village to supplement her husband's income. 

Due to financial difficulty, she aims to improve her business and generate sufficient income for the education of her children, and to satisfy their basic needs. To improve the business, she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional stocks of snack foods, seasonings, beverages, canned goods, rice, fruits, and vegetables to sell. 

She is hoping that someday, she will be successful and financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of snack foods, seasonings, beverages, canned goods, rice, fruits, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 28 years old, married, and lives in Likoni, Kenya with her two children. She is very hardworking and is always setting a good example at home, as every morning she wakes up with new dreams and desires for prospering. She owns a clothing shop where she sells basic clothing for all men, children and women, but mainly secondhand clothes.

She has been a member for the last two years and she has proved to be responsible in loan repayment. Fatuma wants to buy three bundles of clothes: one for men, another for trousers and the third one for women's dresses. That is why she is requesting a loan of KES 20,000. She is grateful for such an opportunity.

loans.use: to buy three bundles of clothes: one for men,  another for trousers and the third one for women's dresses.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de 2 femmes mariées et 2 veuves, les membres de groupe Dembagnouma vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le  commerce d’ignames, de charbon de bois, de chaussures,  d’orange et de pagnes wax. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 14ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame CHATA (1ère assise à droite sur la photo) est la vendeuse de wax et bazins du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 4pièces de pagnes wax et 3 pièces de pagnes bazins. 
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame CHATA compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 52.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Dembagnouma group is made up of 2 married women and 2 widows. The group members live mainly in traditional families and have an average age of 44 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and marriage. The members of the group sell yams, charcoal, shoes, oranges and wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African fabric). The group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business and are on their 14th group loan cycle.

Chata (sitting on the far right in the picture) is the group member who sells wax and damask pagnes. She plans to use her loan to buy 4 bolts of wax pagnes and 3 bolts of damask pagnes. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers and makes her sales for cash or credit, at home and at the market, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. Thanks to this loan, Chata expects to make an average monthly profit of 52 500 francs, part of which will be reinvested in her business and part of which will be used to help her husband cover some of the family's expenditures.

loans.use: to buy bolts of wax and damask pagnes.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
This is Gertrudes. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to buy gardening materials and supplies for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. She will use this loan to buy gardening materials like wire, baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gertrudes hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having a peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more planting materials and fertilizers for her flower farm.

loans.name: Sang'alo A Group

texts.en:
Sang'alo A Group is located in Bungoma South District. It is a group of 10 women and 1 man led by Lynet, pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Lynet first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Lynet joined One Acre Fund in order to gain knowledge in farming and grow enough food for the family 

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Lynet was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 10 bags per ½ acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. Lynet’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 5.5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is 49 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 12 and 25 years. All of her children are in school. Damaris is a farmer and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying her previous loan. Her business is doing better after the loan and she wants to use the money to enable her to buy clothing materials for dressmaking. She hopes to have a better living standard in the near future.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en: Mary Lou is 26 years old and married with 1 child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She operates a manicure and pedicure services business in the local community to earn a living. She's been with her business over 3 years and earns about 1,500 PHP every month. Mary Lou joined GDMPC in 2009 and now she is requesting a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase additional materials to use, like nail polish, nail files and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to use like nail polish, nail files and accessories.

loans.name: Rocky Amad's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 18 femmes existe depuis le 24 octobre 2007, date de création du Banc Villageois qui l'abrite. Il est constitué de femmes qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des alentours. Une entente des femmes et une solidarité avérée fait leur fierté. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Ndéye est âgée de 46 ans, debout sur la photo et levant la main, elle est mariée et mère de 3 garçons et de 3 filles. Elle fait comme activité le commerce, elle vend des tissus. Ainsi avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter divers catégories de tissu( khartoum, wax). 
Les bénéfices obtenus lui permettent de renforcer son commerce pour plus de retombées, ce qui lui servira d'augmenter ses épargnes et de payer ses intérêts.
texts.en:
This group of 18 women has existed since October 24th, 2007, the creation date of the "bank villageois" that it belongs to. It is made up of women who live in the same village and surrounding villages. They are proud of their common understanding and solidarity. Their main business is retail.

Ndéye, standing in the picture and raising her hand, is 46 years old, married and the mother of 3 boys and 3 girls. She is a retailer and sells fabrics. She will therefore use the loan she has received to buy various types of fabrics (khartoum, wax). The profits she earns allow her to strengthen her business and increase her gains, which she will use to build her savings and pay her interest.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is 29 years old and is engaged in a fish selling business as a source of income. In operating this business, she often feels difficulty in selling because of the lack of products to offer. This caused her to ask for a loan amount of PHP 5,000 to buy a variety of fish to sell. Hopefully, with her loan she will increase her volume of sales.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is 55 years old and widowed with 3 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business of selling fish in the local community. She's been with her business over 15 years and earns about 2,000 PHP a month. Antonia joined GDMPC in 2009. She is requesting a loan of 6,500 PHP to rent a fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to rent a fishing boat.

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 21 femmes a été créé depuis le 02/12/2008. Il est composé de femmes issues du même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Le responsable madame Ramata debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo la main levée recouvert d'un écharpe blanc.
Elle est âgée de 62 ans mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 3 garçons et 5 filles.  Madame s'active dans le commerce de légumes depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine .
Avec son nouveau crédit de 200000 franc cfa elle va payer des sacs de manioc,de choux, de carottes et de tomate qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son village.
les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires de toutes sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en: This group of 21 women was created on December 2nd, 2008. It is made up of women who come from the same village and are united by strong social and professional bonds. The group's leader, Ramata, is standing on the left of the picture wearing a white scarf and raising her hand. She is 62 years old, married and the mother of 8 children, 3 of whom are boys and 5, girls. She has been selling vegetables for a long time and has good experience in this line of work. With her new loan of 200 000 francs, she will buy bags of cassava, cabbages, carrots and tomatoes, which she will resell in her village, retail. The profits she earns allow her to cover her whole family's food needs and to build her savings with the "banc villageois".

loans.use: to buy bags of different vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan lives in the Adigeni District. He is 22 years old and single.  He lives with his mother, who works as a saleslady at a local store, and gets a small monthly salary. The income source for the family is agricultural land, where they grow potatoes that they sell seasonally. In addition, Levan works as an auto mechanic and earns a monthly income. 

Levan decided to start a business, as their existing income isn’t enough for the family, and their living conditions are poor. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program has provisions of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. 

With the loan, Levan will purchase a car to use for business purposes to transport agricultural products.  Another part of the credit will be used to purchase a stock of walnuts. He will purchase them wholesale, and resell for a profit in nearby villages. The income of the family will increase, and the living conditions of the family will improve.  In addition, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products, available in the country’s capital market, in the event of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car to transport agricultural products.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine has been a dealer in fish for more than 17 years. She is separated with five grown up children. Geraldine is business oriented and full of hopes in her life and with her fish vending business.

She plans to change the wheels on her truck (elf) and to acquire more kilograms of tilapia to sell within her local community and nearby municipalities. However, because she struggles with a shortage of capital, Geraldine decided to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP 35,000. She hopes to get this amount in order to gain more income that will enable her to sustain her family's needs, improve her financial stability and have a comfortable lifestyle someday.

Geraldine believes that she could be a better entreprenuer someday because of her dedication and new marketing strategies in delivering the goods she offers. She is looking forward to the continuous smooth flow of her fish selling business.

loans.use: to change the wheels on her truck and to buy more kilograms of tilapia to sell.

loans.name: Leonilyn

texts.en:
Leonila is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old and single. To make a living, she operates a family member's business, providing motor transport services. She has been engaged in this business for 3 years and earns about 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for these activities. 

In 2010, she joined GDMPC. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions in the future and to help her parents as well.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Eli Odede

texts.en: Eli is a 26-year-old from Nyahururu, and he is a single man. He has a farming business that he has been operating for the past three years and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use on his farm. Eli hopes to see his farming business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rashmi Ranjan

texts.en:
Rashmi Ranjan is a 36-year-old differently able person living with his wife and two children who are in schooling. 

He is involved in the activity of selling home decorative items and jewelery made of pearl, beads, stones, etc., near the beach in the sacred town of Odisha, India. He purchases these items from the suppliers who are in the nearby villages and he makes a few of the products like necklaces, bracelets, hair bands, etc. 

Rashmi Ranjan roams the beach and sells his product to the tourists and visitors.

He has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR for purchasing more stock of what he sells and a few more things like materials (beads, threads, glue, ribbons, glitter, etc.) for preparing necklaces, bracelets, etc.

He says that doing so will increase his monthly income and he would be able to send his children to a good school and save some money for their future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing home decorative items and materials for making necklaces, bracelets, hair bands, etc.

loans.name: Rey Ann

texts.en: Rey Ann is 26 years old and single. She lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business of selling nipa hut products in the local community to earn a living. She's been with her business for over 3 years and earns about 2,500 PHP a month. Rey Ann joined GDMPC last year and now she is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase raw materials needed to make her products for sale. She hopes in the future to have a better life and to continue her studies.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed to make her products for sale.

loans.name: Joel Kamau

texts.en:
Joel is 64 years old from Olkalou and is married with two children who are in school.

Joel has a transport business that he has been doing for many years and has applied for his second loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy spare parts for his vehicle.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future and be able to employ a few people.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 55 years old, married, and has eight children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and manages a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She's been with her business over three years and earns 2,500 PHP  every month. 

Josephine joined GDMPC in 2012. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, sugar and canned goods. She wants to have a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, sugar and canned goods.

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor, aged 57, is engaged in a hog-fattening business. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feeds, vitamins and one hog. 

She hopes that her hog will have a healthy, well nourished body to make a higher income. With her unending hope to promote their lives, she is looking forward to the improvement of her income through her loan.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and one hog.

loans.name: Henriette Khary

texts.fr:
Madame Henriette est une femme âgée de 53 ans. Elle mariée et mère de 6 garçons dont le plus âgée a 32 ans.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis son cycle premier. Elle a donc eu a bénéficier de plusieurs crédits qu'elle a toujours régulièrement remboursés. 
Elle y collabore avec des femmes de son villages unies par de bons liens sociaux.
Henriette fait du commerce par la vente de denrées alimentaires dans une boutique au niveau de son village.
Son nouveau crédit de 250000 francs cfa lui permettra de payer des sacs de riz de l'huile du sucre et du lait pour les revendre au détails.
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Henriette is a 53-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of 6 boys, the eldest of whom is 32 years old. She has been a member of the "banc villageois" since her first loan cycle. She has therefore been able to benefit from many loans which she has always punctually repaid. She works together with women from her village who are united by strong social bonds.

Henriette sells foodstuffs in a shop in her village. Her new loan of 250 000 francs will enable her to buy some bags of rice, oil, sugar and milk, which will be resold retail. The profits generated by her business allow her to take care of the food, education and health needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Abdukudus

texts.ru:
Абдукудус, мужчина в возрасте 46 лет. Проживает в сельской местности. Женат и имеет пятерых детей,трое из  детей до школьного возраста. Он женился очень поздно поэтому у него маленькие дети.   Жена Абдукудуса в данное время не работает, так как воспитывает детей. В свободное время  от воспитания детей она помогает своему супругу по уходу и кормления крупно рогатого скота. 
Абдукудус на протяжении 15 лет занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. А также подрабатывает в колхозе охранником.  Ему очень тяжело содержать свою семью, так как он зарабатывает один.  То что он зарабатывает охранником все уходит на проживание. Основной доход у него от откорма скота поэтому он старается развивать свой бизнес.  
 На полученный кредит Абдукудус хочет купить скот и до весны откормить.  Весной скот подорожает и он продаст по выгодной цене.  Он заранее благодарит организацию Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdukudus is a 46-year-old man, who lives in a village. He is married with five children, three of which are not yet school-aged. He has young children because he married late. Abdukudus's wife is not currently working because she is raising the children. In her time away from child-rearing, she helps her husband to care for and feed their cattle. 

Abdukudus has raised cattle for 15 years now. He also earns a living working as a guard at the collective farm. It is very difficult for him to support his family financially because he is the family's only source of income. His entire income from his job as a guard is needed simply for survival. His main income comes from raising and feeding cattle. Hence, he is trying to develop this business. If he receives this loan, Abdukudus would like to purchase cattle and feed them until spring. By spring the cattle will be grown and he can sell them for a good price. He thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy a cattle

loans.name: Jesus Felipe

texts.es:
Jesus tiene 29 años de edad, vive en la cálida ciudad de Pisco, caracterizada por sus playas hermosas, su agricultura y también por la generosidad de sus pobladores. Jesus vive al lado de su esposa quien en su fiel compañera y la cual lo anima en todo lo que el hace y sobre todo le brinda su cariño y sus bueno consejos. Debido los pocos recursos económicos Jesus solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de mecánica automotriz.

Día a día Jesus trabaja como ayudante de mecánica, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente, el cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Jesus está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, fierro, arena, ladrillos, entre otros, así el podrá realizar la construcción de un baño para su vivienda, así el podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Jesús is 29 years old and lives in the warm city of Pisco, which is known for its beautiful beaches, farming, and also for the generosity of its residents.  Jesús lives side by side with his wife who is his faithful companion, encourages him in all that he does, and more than anything offers him her love and good advice.

Due to limited financial resources, Jesús was only able to study up to the 5th grade of school, but he would have liked to study how to be an automotive mechanic.  Day by day, Jesús works as a mechanic's assistant.  He works about 9 hours a day and can have up to 10 customers a day.  He believes that he is getting ahead with his job because he is responsible and more than anything has a great desire to get ahead.

Jesús is very grateful for Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help that they have offered him he will be able to buy construction supplies such as cement, iron, sand, bricks, etc.  In this way, he will be able to build a bathroom for his house, improve his quality of life, and continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality: studying a profession in a university.

loans.use: build a bathroom

loans.name: Sophaskra's Group

texts.en:
Sophaskra was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are two members and they live in a village near Phnom Penh City.

Sophaskra, age 19, is single. She lives with her parents. Sophaskra is now in her first year and first semester of accountant institute in Phnom Penh. She will continue to her second semester, hence she decided to apply for a loan of $200 to pay for her school fee. 

Vutha, age 21, is single. He lives with his parents. Vutha is now in his first year and first semester of Royal University of Agriculture in Phnom Penh. He will continue to his second semester, hence he decided to apply for a loan of $200 to pay for his school fee. 

In addition, Vutha also has a part-time job. He is a security guard.

Photo: Sophaskra is on the left and Vutha is on the right.

loans.use: To pay for school fees.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA  ont en moyenne  27 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SIENSO  un village du cercle de SAN / SEGOU  (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires,    de lait, etc.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe  sont  à leur douzième prêt solidaire.
BEMAN  grande vendeuse de lait (la seule femme assise) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter pour acheter 120 litres de lait par jour en vue de ravitailler la Laiterie ‘’Danaya Nono’’ de SAN  en gros. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des bergers du village .Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group have an average age of 27 and, on average, 5 children, and all live in extended, traditional families in Sienso, a village in the Circle of San / Ségou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other via family relationships and sell various items such as groceries and milk. Having correctly repaid the previous loans, the women of the group are on their 12th group loan.

Beman, the only woman sitting down, is a large milk seller and plans to use her loan to buy 120 litres of milk a day, in order to supply the "Danaya Nono" dairy with milk, wholesale. She gets her supplies from the village's shepherds. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 50 000 francs, part of which will be used to cover health, food and educational expenses, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Dounkafa Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les CINQ femmes du groupe Dounkafa  ont  en moyenne 34ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier N°1 de Tominian dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles mènent diverses activités. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 6 ème prêt solidaire. 
Madame Fanta (1ere femme debout vers gauche avec un foulard blanc au coud sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de céréales plus précisément du riz  dans le quartier N° 1  et ses alentours. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs de riz paddy à raison de 10000 FCFA le sac,  pour ensuite les décortiquer. Elle s’approvisionne à la foire de San.et effectue ses ventes à domicile dans son quartier  au comptant, en détail et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes  de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame FANTA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and all living in extended, traditional families, the 5 women of the Dounkafa group have an average age of 34 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in the N°1 district of Tominian, in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other via neighbourly and family relationships. They have different businesses. The members of the Dounkafa group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business and are on their 6th group loan.

Fanta (the woman standing on the left and wearing a white scarf around her neck in the picture) is a large seller of cereals, more specifically of rice, in the N°1 district and the surrounding area. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 bags of paddy rice, at 10 000 francs per bag, and then dehusk it. She gets her supplies at the San market fair and makes her sales door-to-door in her district, for cash and occasionally credit, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. Thanks to this loan, Fanta hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of the households needs.

loans.use: to buy paddy rice.

loans.name: Sandro

texts.es:
Sandro vive en alquiler en la Zona Central de la ciudad de La Paz. Sus gastos muchas veces requieren todo el ingreso que obtiene mensualmente lo que le hace casi imposible poder tener un ahorro.

Trabaja como empleado en una entidad pública de La Paz pero lamentablemente no puede acceder a un mejor sueldo por que no acabó sus estudios universitarios. Por eso requiere el crédito, para poder pagar sus estudios este semestre y dar un paso más para su titulación.

El sueño de Sandro es salir profesional y en el futuro poder comprar una casa propia sin la necesidad de pagar alquiler.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito en Impro y Kiva.
texts.en:
Sandro rents in the downtown area of the city of La Paz.  His expenses sometimes take all his monthly income, making it impossible for him to be able to have savings.

He works as an employee for a public entity in La Paz but unfortunately can't get a better salary because he didn't finish college.  This is why he needs the loan, to be able to pay for his studies this semester and get one step closer to his degree.

Sandro's dream is to become a professional and to buy his own house in the future so he doesn't have to pay rent.

This is the first loan he's requesting from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay tuition to continue his university education

loans.name: Wade

texts.fr:
Madame Wade est une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le cycle premier. Elle a donc plusieurs fois bénéficié de crédits qu'elle a toujours régulièrement remboursés. Elle a de bonnes relations avec les autres femmes du groupe. Elle développe également une harmonie au sein de son village.

Elle s'active dans l’embauche ovine depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Son nouveau crédit de 500000 francs CFA lui permettra de payer des moutons qu'elle va engraisser et revendre au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité.

Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des fournitures scolaires de ses enfants mais également de payer de la nourriture à toute sa famille.
texts.en:
Wade is a 41-year-old woman. She is married and mother of four children.

She has been a member of the banc villageois since her very first loan cycle. She has received several loans, all of which she has correctly repaid. She has a good relationship with the other women in the group. She gets along well with the other residents of her village.

She has been fattening sheep for a long time and is well experienced in that line of work.

Her new 500,000 FCFA loan will enable her to buy sheep, which she will fatten and resell at the weekly markets in her town.

The profits will enable her to help her husband cover the schooling fees for their children and buy food for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a bread distributor and has been in the business for the past six years. He is 33 years old and married to Damaris; they have three children. He distributes the bread to shop retailers and mini-supermarkets as well as hotels.

For his first loan term, he plans to buy a machine for baking bread. Since the demands of his customers have increased, this will enable him to increase production and also boost his daily sales. He plans to use the generated profits to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, Joseph hopes to grow his business and open a big bakery to distribute bread, scones and cakes to supermarkets and retail businesses; hence, he will make more income and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy a machine for baking bread.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is 26 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by operating a small cafe in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of 10,700 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

Luvuno was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of 10,000 KES to buy additional items such as serving trays, plates, water jugs, tea cups and foodstuff such as cooking oil and maize flour for her business. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her cafe. Her goal for the future is to expand the cafe with a view of increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as serving trays, plates, water jugs, tea cups and foodstuff such as cooking oil and maize flour.

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Shagufta is 45-year-old hard-working woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband, three sons and her daughter. Her husband is a taxi driver, while her eldest son works in an insurance company. The rest of the children stay at home.

Her husband's income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Shagufta is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Shagufta is a member of six-person group, and she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new sewing machine to stitch up more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

She is thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sang'alo H Group

texts.en:
Margaret is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Sang'alo H Group members. The 10 of them, four women and six men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant half an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Margaret first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Margaret joined One Acre Fund in order to use increased profits to send her children to school and pay for the loan slowly.

Margaret described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Margaret’s group will receive five acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es: Katherine ha comprado mercancía variada con su credikiva y con ello hizo crecer sus inventarios, solucionando así las necesidades de su clientela y con ello aumentó el volumen de sus ventas. Ella envía un mensaje a sus financiadores que dice así “Contar con su apoyo es importante ya que están ayudando a muchos microempresarios a cumplir sus metas. “ En la actualidad su sueño de crecimiento empresarial no se detiene y planea comprar artículos como lápices, esferos, libretas, colores, sacapuntas, debido a que se acerca una alta temporada que favorece la venta de los útiles escolares y como su ubicación estratégica es cercana a varios colegios y escuelas, su inversión se proyecta como exitosa y esto es lo que justamente hace que ella esté entusiasmada en acceder a un nuevo financiamiento.
texts.en:
Katherine bought a variety of merchandise with her Kiva loan and expanded her inventory.  She satisfied the needs of her customers and increased the volume of her sales.  She sent this message to her lenders: "Having your help is important because you're helping a lot of micro-entrepreneurs realize their goals."

Currently her dream continues, and she plans to buy articles such as pencils, pens, notebooks, colored pencils, and pencil sharpeners because of the upcoming high season for buying school supplies.  Because of her strategic location near several schools, her investment is designed to be successful, which is exactly what makes her enthusiastic about getting another loan.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Chhorm

texts.en: Chhorm is 48 years old and a hardworking woman who is responsible for seven single children. She lives with her partner and children in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Rice husbandry and rice mill service are the main business activities of her family. This couple has a good cooperation because they are on the same way of life, they want to sustain their family’s basic necessities and educate them up to a higher level. Chhorm has tried to seek for ways to improve her general income and she wanted to buy an extra piece of farm for growing rice. Because of the shortage of capital, she is applying for a loan in the sum of 1,100 USD through HKL, one of Kiva’s partners. This loan amount will enable Chhorm to harvest and collect abundant crop yields in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy an extra piece of farm for growing rice.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a 34-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has 2 children. The oldest is 10 while the youngest is 3. Her husband works as a sales clerk.

Ana Marie owns and operates a retail store. She sells commodities like biscuits, beverages, chips, detergents and soft drinks. She has been in the retail business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, chips, noodles, soaps, and soft drinks and will purchase the stocks in bulk to cater to the needs of her customers. In the future, Ana Marie would like to expand her business to support her family, as well as to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, chips, noodles, soaps and soft drinks

loans.name: Atef

texts.en:
Atef is a 25-year-old single man from Deir El- Balah in Gaza. For the past three years, Atef has been selling fruits and vegetables to customers. His project is located in a very good place in the city, is considered as a profitable one and the only source of income the family has. 

Atef would like to develop his business by purchasing a new collection of seasonal fruit and vegetables that customers request and buy, so he is requesting a 1,500 USD Youth loan from FATEN for this purpose. This will increase sales and raise his income and maybe in the future Atef could open a store.

Atef appears in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase more seasonal fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has a retail business in Tala town. She has been running it for the past three years and it has been profitable. She is 39 years of age, married to Charles, and they have two school-going children, ages 15 and 10 years old.

This is Jane's first loan term with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) and she plans to use the amount to buy more goods to sell. These include sugar, bread, rice, and detergents. This will enable Jane to generate more profits with which she plans pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business by adding more stock and, thereby, have a stable source of income which will enable her to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, like sugar, bread, rice, and detergents.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
This is Domingo. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy more spare parts and his tricycle is always in good condition. This has been his business for seven years now. He is the one providing for his family, that's why he is working really hard.

Domingo would like to apply for another PHP 17,000 loan to buy spare parts and provide maintenance to the tricycle unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Domingo hopes that his business will grow and that he will have more tricycles. He dreams to provide his family with a good life. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.


* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of the tricycle (motorcycle transport vehicle).

loans.name: Kanouya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les cinq femmes du groupe kanouya ont  en moyenne 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier N°1 de Tominian dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font la restauration et le commerce d’articles divers. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  8e   prêt solidaire.
Madame, DJENEBA (1ere  femme debout de la  droite vers la  gauche avec foulard blanc noir sur la photo) excelle dans la restauration depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est  très sollicitée dans le grand marché de Tominian  et ses environnants, puisse qu’elle fait de très bon plats selon ses clients qui sont majoritairement constitués des étudiants de l’IFM : (Institut de Formation de Maîtres). 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 sacs de riz, 50 kg d’oignons frais, 2 cartons de concentrées de tomates, une grande quantité d’épices et trois chèvres puisse qu’elle fait aussi de la viande grille. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN et effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame DJENEBA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The five members of the group Kanoyua are married women who live in extended traditional families in Tominian district No.1 in the region of Segou (4th administrative region of Mali). They average 44 years of age and five children each, and they know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They work in restaurant services and commerce. 

To bolster their working capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their 8th group loan. 

Mrs. DJENEBA (standing first from the right and wearing a black and white scarf) has specialized in restaurant services for over ten years. She is in high demand at the big market of Tominian and the surrounding neighborhoods due to her cooking, which is considered excellent by her customers who consist mainly of IFM students (training institute for teachers).

She plans to use her loan to buy five bags of rice, 50 kg of fresh onions, two cartons of tomato concentrate, lots of spices, and three goats as she also serves grilled meat.  

She buys her supplies in SAN, and she conducts her sales at retail, for cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

With this loan, Mrs. DJENEBA expects to earn an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her activity and to help her spouse with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant service.

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is a 46-year-old, married man. For the past one year, Waleed has been a taxi driver. This business has been the only source of income to his family. He owns this taxi, but also he still has installments to pay, to complete paying for its purchase.

Waleed lives with his wife and seven sons, all of whom are under 18 years of age. His income barely covers the family's needs.

Waleed requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Waleed to refinance the remaining amount he owes on the loan he took to buy the taxi. Waleed appears in the photo, next to his taxi.

loans.use: to refinance the remaining amount he owes on the loan he took to buy the taxi.

loans.name: Wajeeh

texts.en:
Wajeeh is a 25-year-old, married man from Gaza city. He lives in a small house, with his wife and a little male son. Wajeeh has owned a men's clothing store, since five years ago. It is a very successful store, because of the good-quality products and its location in a good commercial area in Gaza. But this store needs some support to increase the quantity of the inventory.
 
Wajeeh took a US Dollar, Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help Wajeeh to purchase a new collection of clothes, which will increase the stock in the clothing store so the revenue will increase. Wajeeh had his picture taken in his store.


About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context, by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of men's clothes to sell in his store

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 40 years old. He is married to Florence, and together they have three children. He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is the second loan that he is applying for from KADET LTD. He successfully repaid the previous loan. Moses' business improved because of that loan. He wants to use the money from the new loan to buy wheat flour and sugar to sell in his shop.

He hopes to own a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and sugar to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a loving mother of two children. Her children are both in college level of education, and they attend classes. Myrna has always seen that her children have enough money for going to school, including their other needs in school, like projects and tuition fees.

Myrna is 41 years of age. Her husband is a farmer, and a tricycle operator as well. Myrna engages in a sari-sari (convenience store) business in their village. She sells snack foods, beverages and condiments, like cooking oil, vinegar and soy sauce. She also sells some vegetables.

Myrna wants to diversify the items she currently sells. She is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy spices, powdered juice, canned goods, and breads. In the future, her children will finish their education as a result of income she earns from the business, and they will become professionals some day.

loans.use: to buy spices, powdered juice, canned goods, and breads, to add to the other items she currently sells in her store.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 49-year-old married man and a father of three children. He has been selling coffee and hot drinks for five years. Mohamad's business is located in a vegetable and fruit wholesale market, and almost all of his customers are from the market.
Mohamad is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his supply of coffee. The loan will also supply him with the capital to meet the business needs of his cafe as he acts to expand his business as much as he can.
Mohamad is a hardworking man, who seeks perfection in his business. He works to make sure that the cafe will provide him with a good income so that he can meet his family's needs. 
This is Mohamad's fifth cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, and he has a good history of repayment. His previous loans had a good impact on his social and financial living.

loans.use: To purchase more coffee and meet the business needs of his cafe

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 29 years old, married, and has one child who is two years old. He is from Ndunyu Njeru. John has a general shop that he has been running for the past five years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to buy sugar, cooking fat, beverages, etc. to add to his inventory. He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, beverages, and cooking fat for his store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
MARIA
Doña María Es casada y madre de familia, es originaria de Sumpango, Sac, doña María es propietaria de un puesto de venta de helados asi como también se dedica  a la crianza de animales, todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano ya que tiene que aprovechar el día para lograr las cosas que se propone ya que diariamente tiene que preparar helados de frutas  para que se congelen y lo pueda vender , después de haber terminado la preparación, empieza a atender a los animales que tienen que son pollos de corral , ella es muy trabajadora y ha logrado a colaborar con el sustento de su familia además está muy feliz pues porque todos sus hijos ya se graduaron y estudian en la universidad, además cuenta que gracias  a la ayuda que kiva le brindo pudo pagar el estudio de su hijo menor , por tal razón solicita un crédito nuevamente para seguir apoyando a su familia. y compra mas insumos para la elaboracion de helados.
texts.en: MARIA - María, who is married and a mother, comes from Sumpango, in the Sacatepéquez department of Guatemala.  She owns a stall where she sells ice cream and combines this with animal breeding.  She gets up very early each morning so as to make the most of the time available for getting everything done; her fruit ice cream has to be prepared daily so that it can freeze and she can sell it.  After preparing her ice cream, she then starts to attend to her animals (free-range chickens).  She is very hard-working and has managed to contribute to the household expenses.  Furthermore, she is very happy because all her children have now left school and are studying at university.  She is also very grateful for the help provided by Kiva which enabled her to pay for her youngest son's studies.  She is now applying for another loan to enable her to continue supporting her family and buy supplies for making ice cream.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making ice cream to sell

loans.name: Crispus' Group

texts.en: Crispus, a 52-year-old subsistence farmer and father of 12, is eager to join the KOMAZA microforestry program. He says, "I was pleased with the idea that through tree planting I can get some money in the future." Crispus has seen the success of tree farming from his neighbors who planted trees with KOMAZA in the previous years. With his proceeds from his eventual tree harvest, Crispus wants to build a permanent house and open businesses. He is proud that "at least I can say I am on the way out of poverty."

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a young entrepreneur, currently single. She offers various kinds of cosmetic products, such as lipstick, makeup kits, eye liner, eye shadow, blush, and some personal hygiene items for women, children, and men. She has been running her direct-selling business for three years. 

She is thankful because she is able to earn about PHP 7,000 per month. She used her gained income to pay her family's basic commodities, create savings, and some amount was used to finance her backyard piggery business. 

Jonalyn would like to have continuous improvement of her direct-selling and piggery businesses. To make all this possible, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000, allowing her to buy more stocks of cosmetic products. She knows that, through satisfying her customers' demands, she could encourage more customers to patronize her businesses and she could earn greater income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cosmetic products, such as lipstick, makeup kits, eye liner, eye shadow, and some personal hygiene items for her cosmetic sales business.

loans.name: Tsavrina

texts.en:
Tsavrina is from the village of Boslevi. She is 67 years old and lives with her husband and 12-year-old grandson. Tsavrina and her husband are pensioners. Their son and daughter-in-law live and work abroad to financially help the family. The family earns a living through an agricultural business. In particular, they own bee-hives with bee colonies and sell produced honey locally. In addition, Tsavrina grows nuts and maize on the family-owned land. She does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. Tsavrina is a very hardworking person, with a rich experience in her work.
Tsavrina requested a loan to purchase a milking cow. She will be able to produce and sell cheese. She wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and the living conditions for the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Sang'alo J Group

texts.en:
Metrine is a member of Sang'alo J Group, in Bungoma South District. The group, pictured here, is comprised of 11 One Acre Fund farmers, all women. Metrine is standing on the right, with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Metrine’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year, in order to access the best input prices and to use her increased profits to send her children to school.

Last year, Metrine harvested three bags of maize on one-half acre of land. She is excited by the prospect of improving her harvest, as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Sang'alo J Group members will take input loans of ½ acre, each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 28-year-old, single lady, who supports her 8-year-old child. She has been knitting sweaters for sale, and also sells school uniforms. She has been in this business for five years, and her monthly income from the business is KES 50,000.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000, which she intends to use to purchase knitting materials and to buy new school uniforms for resale. She plans to use the additional income, to reinvest back into the business and to improve the living standard for herself and her child. Her dream is to give the best education possible to her child.

loans.use: To purchase knitting materials add new stock of school uniforms for sale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Two of his children attend school. He is in the agricultural trade business, dealing primarily with beans, ground nuts, and maize. Francis is also involved in farming as another source of income to take care of the family.

Francis wants a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more beans, maize, and ground nuts for the business. He wants to purchase these items now since the prices are still low and there is a good supply. These items are currently in season. He anticipates selling the produce at a much higher profit when the season is off and realizing good returns from the business.

His dream is to educate his children up to higher levels of learning using the proceeds from the produce business. He also intends to buy more land for farming to increase production. However, Francis has a challenge of the changing weather affecting the agricultural production as well as the changing prices in the market. In the photo, Francis is with the Ugafode credit officer in a tie and badge.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize, and ground nuts

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur lives in the suburb of Georgia's capital city Tbilisi. He is 46 years old and lives with his son and daughter-in-law. Zaur’s wife lives and works in Turkey to help her family financially. Zaur has a car and serves locals as a taxi driver. Several times, Zaur has requested loans from local credit providers, but his loan requests were always rejected because of his lack of experience in new business. His current loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. They do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers,” because of their low incomes. With the received credit, Zaur will start up a fast-food café. He will sell sandwiches, pies, and carbonated drinks. Zaur hopes his business will be profitable and that he will attract many customers since there is no similar café nearby. The profit will be reinvested in the same business and Zaur will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to start up a fast-food cafe

loans.name: Gulo

texts.en:
Gulo is 45 years old. She lives in the small village of Kaspi District with her two sons and a daughter-in-law. Gulo requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land and grow haricot. Gulo also works as a cleaner at local poultry-raising farm. There is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Gulo requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor. They do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers,” because of low income. With the received credit Gulo will buy and sell bed-clothing. She plans to go to Turkey and buy bed-clothing from the wholesalers and then resale at higher price among her villagers. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up, loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy and sell bed-clothing

loans.name: Mara Luz

texts.es: Mara de 40 años, aprendió de su madre de oficio artesana, todo lo que hoy sabe hacer en materia de manualidades. Con este legado, ella logró emprender su propia aventura de negocio, en el que fabrica collares, aretes, pulsos, y hasta mochilas; artículos que vende a turistas que visitan su pueblo y tiendas de artesanías,  con los que lleva años negociando. Su mercado cada día crece mas y sus posibilidades de producir   artesanía es cada día menor, porque su capital de trabajo no es suficiente, para responde con una buena oferta diversificada, la demanda planteada. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará tubos plásticos, fibras, de arroz o de fique, hilos, anzuelos, pintura, entre otros insumos con los cuales aumentará su producción. Con esta inversión Mara tendrá una mayor oferta de artículos, aumentará el número de clientes para finalmente con su trabajo, ahorrar y que su hijo  con el cual sueña ver convertido en un profesional exitosos, pueda hacerlo y es que este es el motor que dinamiza su tarea diaria y por el cual se esfuerza con el fin de lograrlo.
texts.en: Mara, 40, learned how to be an artisan from her mother and she knows how to make everything using craft materials. Using these skills, she started her own business making necklaces, earrings, bracelets and bags, items that she sells to tourists that visit her town as well as crafts stores that she has been doing business with for years.  The market where she sells her goods is growing everyday and her production is down because she doesn't have the working capital to diversify her product line to meet the rising demand.  She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy plastic tubing, rice or sisal fiber, thread, clasps, paint and other supplies so she can increase her production. This investment will allow Mara to offer her customers more choices and increase her clientele so that she can finally save and help her son to become a successful professional, something she’s always dreamed of. This is what drives her daily in her work and what she strives to achieve.

loans.use: supplies to make bags, necklaces, earrings and bracelets.

loans.name: Patima

texts.en:
Patima is 50 years old. She lives in the small village of Kaspi District with her 15-year-old son. Her son is an invalid and gets an invalid pension of 52 lari per month. Patima requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land and grow potatoes and haricot.  Patima also works as a cleaner at local poultry-raising farm. There is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Patima requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor. They do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers,” because of low income. With the received credit Patima will buy a milk cow.  After purchasing a milk cow, Patima will produce dairy products to sell in the village. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 29 years old, comes from Nyahururu, and is a single man.

Jackson has a farming business, which he has been running for the past six years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings, to use in his farm. He hopes to improve his family's standard of living, in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Chabuki

texts.en: Chabuki is 45 years old and lives in the Terjola district. He lives with his wife and two children (11 and 16 years old). The family runs a dairy farm of two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market. In addition, Chabuki owns three pigs and sells piglets seasonally. The family has a vineyard as well; they produce wine with the harvested grapes, which they sell locally. Besides his agricultural activities, Chabuki works as a cook at a restaurant and earns a small monthly salary. Chabuki is a hardworking man who is responsible and very well known in the area for his big heart and friendliness with others. Chabuki requested a loan to purchase chicks and start poultry farming. Chabuki will raise chickens and then sell the hens at a good price. He considers his business to be profitable, since it generates a good income that enables him to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 54 years old, married and blessed with five children. She is a small scale farmer and has been doing this for the past 20 years with an average monthly income of KES.10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan with KADET LTD in the amount of KES. 40,000. She will use the whole loan to purchase farm inputs.

With the anticipated profits from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop in order to diversify her sources of income.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Ms. Saima is a 33-year-old married mother of three children. She is striving hard to meet her family's needs, including food, clothing, and education. She began doing stitching work in her house to contribute to the family income. She has now become well known for her work in her community and has a regular list of customers. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR. She will use the money to buy raw materials, including spools of thread, packs of buttons, and zippers in various colors, to meet the increasing demands of her customers without fail. She is in her second loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread, packs of buttons, and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 42-year-old man.  He supports six people in his family and is married to Magrate.  They have been blessed with five children whose ages are, 15, 13, 11, eight and six years old respectively.

Joshua purchases domestic animals and fattens them to sell. He has been doing this for the last 15 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 60,000. He is taking his third loan with KADET LTD. which he will use to increase his stock by purchasing more cows for sale.

He will use the anticipated profits to grow his business by transporting the animals where there is a ready market for them. He has a dream of growing his business and earn more income that will support his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock by purchasing more cows.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 24 years old, married and a father of one child. For the last four years he has earned a living by offering point to point transportation services in Malindi using a Tuk Tuk. He earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of their credit officers, and is applying for his second loan of KES. 40,000. He is going to use a portion of the loan to service and repair his Tuk Tuk (Rickshaw) and use the remaining amount to stock a fruit and vegetable kiosk currently being run by his wife.

Samuel will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his child's school fees. His goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to service and repair his TukTuk (Rickshaw) and buy assorted fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years Margret has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells raw foods.

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food such as bananas and cassava, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and allow her to expand her business by adding a variety of raw foods. 

Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to build a good house.
Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw foods such as bananas and cassava.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen is student from Yerevan. He studies at Armenian State Agrarian University, in the economic department.
Gurgen lives with his parents and grandparents who are on a retirement pension.
Gurgen's parents work hard to sustain the family, but it is difficult for them to save money for their son's education.
So, in order to help his parents, Gurgen has applied for this loan. With the loan's help Gurgen will pay for his university tuition. This will enable him to complete his education.
Gurgen is a proactive and hardworking young man who dreams to become a good specialist, find a well-paid job and help his parents to sustain the family.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras De Rancho Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana Cecilia esta casada, tiene 36 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos de quienes 1 esta estudiando, se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, antibióticos, jarabes, capsulas, etc; negocio que inicio con poco capital y pocos productos, hasta el momento lleva 14 años de experiencia, cuenta con  el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo que le servirá para la compra de productos para su negocio, tales como: sueros, capsulas, vitaminas, y otros productos necesarios para su negocio y clientes, espera en el futuro contar con capital grande y propio.
