Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio, crianza de animales y a la prestación de servicios de venta de refacciones.
texts.en:
Juana Cecilia, 36, is married and completed fourth grade in elementary school.  She has four children one of which is attending school.  She sells medicine, antibiotics, syrups, capsules, etc.  She started the business with little capital and few products and to date has 14 years’ experience.  She can count on her husband’s support; he’s in the same kind of business.

She organized a group that she’ll use to buy products like serums, capsules, vitamins and other necessary products for her business and her customers.  She hopes in future to have large capital of her own.  The other group members work in commerce, animal husbandry and in selling spare parts.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 50 years old and lives in Olkalou. He is married with one child, who is 16 years old and is in secondary school.

Julius has a quarry business that he has been running for the past 12 years and has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy modern machinery to use in his quarry.

He hopes to expand his business and to be able to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy modern machinery

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en:
Ms. Misbah is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been in the business of tailoring for four years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband alone worked for their family, they would not be able to meet the household expenses in addition to the educational needs of children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. Along with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business.  

Misbah has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons, laces and needles. This way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand of her customers consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Misbah hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons, laces and needles.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, se dedica a elaborar y vender repostería. Dice que su primer préstamo Kiva, fue de mucha ayuda y útil pues llego cuando más lo necesitaba pudo invertir en compra de materia prima y moldes para hacer sus deliciosos postres. Cuentas con un mejor número de clientela ahora le piden un poco más de sus productos, está muy agradecida por ayudarla a tener un respaldo financiero y abrirle la puerta para que su negocio prospere.
Ella está requiriendo un financiamiento para comprar saborizantes, azúcar, aceite, harina, mantequillas, huevos, polvo de hornear. Por lo pronto su meta es sacar variedades en repostería, seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y hacerlo estable cada día.
texts.en:
Mariana lives in the city of Granada and works making and selling pastries.  She says that her first Kiva loan was very useful and helpful because it arrived when she most needed it and she was able to buy raw materials and molds to make her delicious desserts.  She now has a larger clientele and a higher number of requests for her products.  She’s very grateful for having been helped to have financial back-up and for opening a door towards her business’ progress.

She needs financing to buy flavoring agents, sugar, oil, flour, butter, eggs and baking powder.  For now, her goal is to produce a variety of pastries and continue investing in her business to make it more stable every day.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 29 years old and divorced. She decided to initiate her own business to support her family instead of becoming burden for them.  She began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. She is familiar with the stitching techniques and has attained a regular list of customers. 

Due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting her fourth loan from Kashf Foundation for 20,000 PKR, which she will use to buy raw material including spools of threads, packs of buttons, and zippers in various colors. She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase raw material including spools of threads, packs of buttons, and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Justo, de 64 años es un hombre trabajador y responsable. Enviudó hace aproximadamente 5 años, de los cuales tuvo que enfrentar junto a sus 3 hijos el día a día en su casa propia. Nace de una familia agrícola, es natural de campo y siempre anheló ser un gran agricultor con una buena producción en sus cosechas. Sus principales cultivos son papa y arveja, hasta ahora tiene gran optimismo por seguir adelante y piensa que las perdidas del año pasado no son de considerarse; el opina en mirar al futuro y es por ello que expresara que le va bien, Don Justo sigue trabajando a pesar de que sus fuerzas se ven debilitadas por su avanzada edad. Pero no se siente cansado, ya que sacó adelante a sus hijos, quienes terminaron de estudiar una educación superior, “Eduqué a mis hijos con la agricultura y ganadería, además ahora me dedico a vender ropa, con estos negocios me siento útil y puedo cuidar de mi salud sin molestar a mis hijos”, afirma. Ahora posee ovejas en gran cantidad a las que cuida en sus tiempos libres, desea vender los animales maduros y comprar otros mejores y jóvenes para renovar su ganado.  Este es el crédito número 11 con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo ofrecido durante todo este tiempo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues siempre fue responsable y trabajador.
Justo, invertirá el dinero en la compra de ovejas para renovar su rebaño.
texts.en:
Justo, 64, is a hard-working and responsible man who has his own home. His wife died about 3 years ago and he and his 3 children are confronted with this daily. He was born into a farming family so farming comes naturally to him. He has always longed to be a great farmer that has a good crop production. His main crops are potatoes and peas. He has always been very optimistic about getting ahead and doesn't dwell on his previous year’s losses. He looks to the future and feels that all will be well. Justo continues to work in spite of the fact that he is getting older and isn't as strong as he used to be. However, he isn't tired since he provided for his children who have finished their education. “I taught my children to farm and raise livestock and now I also sell clothing.  This makes me feel useful and I can care for my own health without having to bother my children.” He currently has a large number of sheep that he cares for in his free time. He wants to sell the animals when they are mature and buy better, younger animals to renew his flock. This is his 11th loan with MFP and he is grateful for the support he has been given. He promises to make his payments on time as he is always responsible and a hard worker. 

Justo will use the loan to buy sheep to renew his flock.

loans.use: purchase sheep to renew his flock.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 38 years old and married with five children, ages one, three, five, ten, and twelve. Four of her children are in school. The family lives in Montserrado County, which is the number one commercial area in Liberia, since it contains the capital city of Liberia. Peace is a university graduate. 

Since 2007, Peace has been involved in the sales of artificial hair and related products. Most interestingly, she has many customers since she sells quality hair and products. She started her business with a loan from her father, and learned about this way of selling from her friends. She spends eight hours on her business. One of the problems she faces is vehicle traffic: since the location of her shop is bit far from her house, she sometimes arrives late to open her shop. 

Peace is requesting a loan to buy more artificial hair and related products to expand her business. She plans to expand her business even more and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more artificial hair and related products to expand her business

loans.name: Willian Omar

texts.es:
Willian tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios como molinero desde  hace veinticinco años; este oficio lo aprendio junto a su padre. A demás se dedica al oficio de estructuras métalicas que tambien lo aprendio de su padre. Sus dos hijos se encuentran estudiando en la primaria; Willian se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para atender a sus clientes, aprovecha a afilar los discos del molino para brindar un mejor servicio. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reparar un motor, comprar unas fajas y unos discos para el molino. Necesita reparar el motor y adquirir esos insumos, porque este es su fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia. él posee dos motores cuando se le arruina uno tiene el otro de repusto asi que es ncesario tener el otro listo para no dejar de trabajar. Su sueño, es ver a sus hijos graduados en la universidad y por eso él lucha cada día.
texts.en:
Willian, 39, is married and has two children.  He has worked providing milling services for 25 years; he learned this occupation from his father.  He also works building metal structures which he also learned from his father.  His two children are attending elementary school.  Willian rises at 5am to start tending to his customers; he uses that time to sharpen the mill’s disks to provide better service.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to repair a motor, buy some bands and some disks for the mill.  He needs to repair the motor and buy these supplies because it’s his source of family support.  He owns two motors and when one breaks down he has the other one ready so he always needs to have the other one ready in order to work uninterruptedly.  His dream is to see his children graduate from university and this is why he strives daily.

loans.use: to repair a motor, buy some bands and some disks for the mill.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Ms. Uzma is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of one child.  Three years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people in the surrounding area and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds Uzma is unable to fully meet the daily demands of her customers.  For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, lace and zippers. The additional materials will be a means of increasing revenues so that she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, lace and zippers.

loans.name: Oscar Osmin

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 47 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia unos diez años de edad, se acompaño y continuo trabajando en lo mismo, debido a que no se le presento la posibilidad de estudiar. Tambien se dedica a la albañileria, oficio que aprendio con un amigo. De esos dos trabajos él obtiene los ingresos para su familia; uno de sus hijos es bachiller y esta casado los otros dos estan en la primaria. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para aprovechar el tiempo y salir temprano al trabajo, debido a que tiene que caminar unos treinta minutos a pie, regresa a su casa hasta la mediodia y si hay mucho trabajo solo almuerza y se regresa al trabajo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos toretes para aprovechar el repasto que quedo de la cosecha. Esto nunca lo lograria comprar por sus propios medios ya que son muy pobres y a él le gusta tener sus animales. Su deseo es trabajar muy fuerte y ahorrar para instalar el agua potable en su casa, ya que tiene que agarrearla en su espalda y otro de sus sueños es que sus hijos estudien en la universidad.
texts.en:
Oscar, 47, has a spouse and three children.  He’s worked in agriculture since he was about ten years old.  When he became partnered he continued working in the same occupation because he never got the opportunity to study.  He also works in construction, an occupation he learned with a friend.  He earns income from these two occupations to support his family.  One of his children graduated high school and is married and his other two attend elementary school.  

He rises at 4:30am to take advantage of his time and head out to work early because he must walk for about 30 minutes.  He returns home at noon and if there is a lot of work to do he only has lunch and returns to work.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy two bullocks to consume the forage left over from harvest.  He’d never be able to accomplish this on his own because they are very poor and he likes having animals.  He wants to work hard to save up to install potable water at home since he currently has to carry it on his back; another of his dreams is that his children attend university.

loans.use: to buy two bullocks.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Ms. Farida is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been in the clothing business for the last two years. She buys clothes of different varieties from the city and sells them in her local community. She earns enough profit through her business to contributes well to the family income.  Her husband is a government employee, but his income alone is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members.

Farida is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 25,000. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase a greater variety of clothes in different colors and designs, taking into account the tastes and choices of her customers. In this way she would be able to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 51 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Su experiencia es muy amplia en el negocio de mariscos. él aprendio este negocio junto a su compañera de vida, pues no tenian un empleo permanente y optaron por esta forma de subsistencia. Tambien se dedican a la crianza de cerdos y venderlos cuando ya estan gordos. Para comprar los mariscos se levantan a las 5:00 a.m. para ir al mercado más cercano en donde llegan pescadores de las islas y playas a vender su producto. Luego Julio se traslada en autobús a revender el marisco. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mariscos y cuatro cerdos para engordarlos. Así suplira la demanda de sus clientes y abarcara a más clientes potenciales para obtener buenos ingresos para la familia. él desea ahorrar para comprarse un pick up y realizar sus viajes de forma más rápida y fácil.
texts.en:
Julio is fifty-one years old, has a life companion, and has three children.  He has a lot of experience in the seafood business.  He learned this business together with his life companion; they did not have permanent employment and opted for this form of subsistence.  They also make a living in raising pigs, fattening and selling them.  

To buy the seafood, they rise at 5:00am to go to the closest market where the island and beach fishermen come to sell their products.  Later, Julio travels by bus to resell the seafood.  

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy seafood and four pigs for fattening.  In doing this, he will supply the demand of his clients and will be able to serve more potential clients, thereby obtaining a good income for the family. 

He hopes to save up in order to buy himself a pick-up truck so that he can make his trips more quickly and easily.

loans.use: to buy seafood and four pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José, 54 años de edad, de oficio pescador, padre de 4 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando y los otros dos son unos gemelos que aun están pequeños. Él dice que vivió desde pequeños en las Isletas de Granada, sus padres lo criaron  en medio de lanchas y redes para pescar , así que fue el único oficio que aprendió para sobrevivir y con lo cual sobrevive él y sus hijos. 
Sale a vender sus frescos pescados de agua dulce a la ciudad de Granada. La época de verano está cerca y la afluencia de turistas es constante y desea aprovechar la temporada alta para vender más. Requiere comprar redes de pescar porque las que tiene actualmente ya no le sirven y necesita trabajar con herramientas en buenas condiciones, que es para lo cual utilizara en financiamiento.
Otro de sus proyectos es poder comprar un bote con motor nuevo para poder contratar a otras personas para conseguir  más volumen de sus productos.
texts.en:
José, age 54, is a fisherman.  He has four children.  Two of them go to school, and the other two, twins, are still little.  He says that he has lived in the Isletas de Granada since he was little.  His parents raised him among boats and fishing nets.  That is why it is the only trade he learned in order to survive.  That is how he and his children survive.

He goes to the city of Granada to sell his freshwater fish.  Summertime is close, and there is a constant flow of tourists.  He wants to take advantage of the high season is order to sell more.

He needs to buy fishing nets because the ones that he now has do not work.  He needs to work with tools that are in good condition.  That is what he will use the loan for.

Another one of his projects is to be able to buy a boat with a new motor.  He wants to do this in order to be able to hire other people to get a greater volume of his products.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Pedro De Jesús

texts.es:
Don Pedro tiene 61 años de edad, es casado. Él se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura, oficio que aprendio de sus padres. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para prepararse y marcharse al terreno en donde trabaja llevando todos los insumos agricolas que necesitan junto con su esposo, caminan unos tres kilometros; ya que no tienen hijos que le ayuden solo ellos trabajan los 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, semilla, pesticidas, herbicidas; antes de sembrar en el invierno ya que en esa temporada suben de precios los insumos agricolas y si le alcanza comprara una vaca. Su deseo es comprar más vacas lecheras para procesar la leche y venderla.
texts.en:
Pedro is 61 years old and is married. He has worked as a farmer his whole life, a profession he learned from his parents. He gets up at 5 am to get ready and go to the land where he works. He and his wife walk 3 kilometers, carrying all of the farming supplies they need. Since they don’t have children to help, they work 21,000 square meters of corn themselves.

He will use the loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and herbicides. Before planting in the winter, since this is when the price of agricultural supplies goes up, he would like to buy a cow. He wants to buy more cows so he can process the milk and sell it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, herbicides and a cow.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 30 years old and single. Geoffrey has a cattle selling business and a secondary business of fruit vending.

He has applied for his fifth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more fruits to add to his stock. He paid his previous loan well. 

He hopes to become a renowned livestock dealer in the near future and also to see his fruit business expand.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to add to his stock.

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
José tiene 59 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Se dedica a administrar su propia tienda desde hace veinte años. Aprendio este negocio, pues no tenia una profesión ni empleo, por lo que opto por este forma de conseguir ingresos para subsistencia de su familia. La tienda esta ubicada en su casa que esta en el centro de su comunidad, por lo que sus habitantes comprarn ahí en lugar de viajar hasta la ciudad. Para comprar los insumos debe pagar  un pick up que lo lleve hasta la ciudad para comprar todo lo que necesita para la tienda.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos quintales de ázucar, dos cuñetas de aceite, 100 libras de fríjol, cuatro quintales de maíz, entre otros productos de la canasta básica.  De esta, manera suplira las necesidades de su clientes, contando con diversidad de productos y en mayores cantidades; para vender más y obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan que su tienda sea más grande.
texts.en:
José, 59, has a spouse and three children.  He has worked managing his own store for 20 years.  He learned this business because he had neither a profession nor a job which is why he opted for this means of earning family income.  The store is located at home which is in the center of his community so residents buy there instead of going all the way to the city.  To buy his supplies he must pay a pick-up truck to take him to the city to buy everything he needs for the store.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy two quintals of sugar, two small barrels of oil, 100 pounds of beans, four quintals of corn among other basic staple items.  In this way, he’ll be able to meet customer needs having a variety of goods on hand in larger amounts to sell more and earn higher income which will make it possible for his store to be larger.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo pequeño, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona bajo San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas elaborando empanadas para venderlas en la puerta de su casa ya que con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, pago de servicios y manutención de su hijo.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital en la elaboración de empanadas, comprando harina y otros productos al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos, ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos, ya que con estos ingresos también ayuda a su madre que es mayor de edad.
El sueño de Evelyn, es tener una tienda para ofrecer más productos ya que actualmente vende sobre una mesita en la puerta de su casa, soportando los cambios de clima.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a single mother, and she has one little child.  She lives in her parents’ house, occupying only one room.  The house is in the Bajo San Antonio area of the city of La Paz.

She currently works for over ten hours a day making empanadas.  She sells them at the doorstep to her house.  With what she earns she needs to cover the expenses for food, services, and supporting her child.

She needs the loan to increase her capital for making empanadas.  She will buy flour and other products wholesale.  That way she will decrease her costs because she wants to improve her income.  With this income she will also help her elderly mother.

Evelyn’s dream is to have a store in which to sell her products.  She now sells from a little table at the doorstep to her house, and she deals with the changes in the weather.  

This is the first time that she has worked with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour and other wholesale products in order to continue with her business of making empanadas.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora de 28 años es una madre muy abnegada quien comparte una vida conyugal con Edgar de 31 años y tiene la alegría de poseer a 3 grandes motivos de esfuerzo como son sus hijos Jhon, Maicol y Enrique. Comparte sus vivencias familiares en una vivienda construida a base de adobe adquirida poco después de su unión conyugal. Desde muy niña participó en la producción de cacao y café orgánico junto a sus padres, años después su vasta experiencia le basto para valerse por si misma, y junto a Edgar lograron salir adelante con una parcela heredada de sus padres, siendo su principal sustento de su economía familiar.
Como los años pasan y los hijos crecen, recuerda muy bien cuando inicio la construcción de su vivienda y años después notaron que el techo necesitaba ser reparado con urgencia, para evitar las constantes goteras que se presentan en esta temporada de lluvias; de esta manera esperan brindarles a sus pequeños una mejor calidad de vida. Desea a futuro iniciar la construcción de su vivienda a base de cemento y ladrillos y se siente muy segura de conseguirlo a largo plazo siempre y cuando muestre como siempre la motivación para trabajar y salir adelante. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, se siente muy contenta por ser beneficiaria de un crédito y se compromete a ser una socia muy puntual en el pago de su préstamo.
En esta primera ocasión desea contar con 500 nuevos soles para la compra de calaminas y proceder con la reparación del techo de su domicilio para evitar goteras.
texts.en:
Flora is twenty-eight years old and is a very selfless mother.  She shares a married life with Edgar, who is thirty-one years old, and they have the happiness of possessing three great motives in life: their three children, Jhon, Maicol, and Enrique.  They live together as a family in a home made of adobe, which they acquired a little after they married.  

Since she was very young, Flora has participated in the production of cacao and organic coffee, together with her parents.  Years after all this vast experience, she had enough knowledge to start herself, and together with Edgar, they fought to get ahead with a plot of land inherited from her parents.  This is the main source of livelihood for the family.

As the years pass and the children grow up, she remembers very well when she began the construction of her home; years later, they have noticed that the roof needs to be repaired as soon as possible in order to avoid the constant leaks that occur in the rainy season.  In making this repair, they hope to offer their children a better quality of life.

In the future, she hopes to begin to construct her home from cement and bricks; she feels certain that she will succeed in doing this, as long as she always has the motivation to work and move forward.  

This is her first loan with MFP.  She feels very happy to be receiving a loan and promises to be a member who is very punctual with her loan payments.  

She wishes to have 500 soles in order to buy corrugated metal sheets so that she can continue with the repairs to the roof of her home and avoid leaks.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets in order to proceed with the repairs to the roof of her home.

loans.name: Petrona Lylliam

texts.es:
Petrona, madre de 3 hijos, vende chinela de hule y ropa. El préstamo le permitió expandirse a otras zonas de venta a las cual no podía llegar pues no tenía suficiente productos que ofrecer. Ahora tiene más clientela, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad brindada.  
Desea comprar más mercadería como sandalias de cuero, sandalias de hule de diferentes estilos, ropa interior. La temporada de verano está cerca y estos son los productos que mas vende, además que la mayoría de sus clientes son personas de muy escasos recursos y este tipo de calzado son una opción más accesible para vestirse y calzarse.
texts.en: Petrona, a mother of 3, sells rubber slippers and clothing. The [previous] loan allowed her to expand into other areas of sales which she had been unable to access because she did not have enough products to offer.  She now has more customers and is grateful for the opportunity provided.  She would like to buy more merchandise such as leather sandals, different styles of rubber sandals, and underwear.  The summer season is coming and these are the products that she sells the most.  They are also the most affordable type of shoes for her customers, the majority of whom are people of modest means.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as leather sandals, different styles of rubber sandals, and underwear.

loans.name: Juanita Antonia

texts.es:
Juanita, habita en la ciudad de Granada, es dueño de una mini pulpería y venta de cosméticos, tiene 4 hijos de 2,5,11 y 15 años de edad. 
Inicio con capital que le brindo su esposo comenzó a comprar granos básicos que son parte de los productos mas populares y de alto consumo. Después la invitaron a una conferencia de ventas de cosméticos por catálogo y le gusto decidió invertir en comprar de estos productos para vender en la pulpería, también asistió a un taller para mujeres emprendedoras donde se promovió la venta de artesanías locales para obtener otras formas de ingresos. Ella siempre esta en busca de progresar  junto con su familia. Su expectativa es mantener su pulpería con productos variados.
Solicito el crédito para comprar granos básicos al por mayor, aceite, frijol, azúcar, café, huevos, avenas, detergentes, cloro, jabones, sopas, salsas, papel higiénico etc.
texts.en: Juanita lives in the city of Granada and is the owner of a small store selling groceries and cosmetics.  She has 4 children who are 2, 5, 11 and 15 years old.  She started with capital provided to her by her husband, by buying basic products which are some of the best-selling consumer products.  She was later invited to a conference for catalogue cosmetic sales, and decided to buy some of these products to sell in her store.  She also attended a workshop for women entrepreneurs where the sale of local artesanal products was promoted as a way of earning additional income.  She is always looking for ways to get ahead together with her family.  Her expectation is to maintain her store with a variety of products.  She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale basic products such as oil, beans, sugar, coffee, eggs, oats, detergents, bleach, soap, sauces, toilet paper, etc.

loans.use: to buy wholesale basic products such  as oil, beans, sugar, coffee, eggs, oats, detergents, bleach, soap, sauces and toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger, tiene la edad de 50 años y vive solo actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar los materiales para la terminar de construir su casa. El actualmente está terminando de realizar su casa pero el dinero no le alcanzo por lo cual solicito este crédito para terminar de construirla y tener un mejor hogar para su vivencia diaria. El espera poder darle todos los acabados a su casa y así poder gozar de la comodidad de su nuevo hogar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Roger is 50 years old and lives alone.  With the loan he would like to buy materials to complete the construction of his house.  He is now working on completing his house but does not have enough money.  For this reason he is requesting this loan, in order to complete the construction and have a better place to live.  He hopes to be able to provide all the finishings to his house and thus be able to enjoy the comfort of his new home.  This is the first loan that he has received through FUDECOSUR.  He has not received other loans previously from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan to him with greater ease and at much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy materials for construction.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Ms. Safia is a 30-year-old married woman. She has expertise in hand-embroidery and is using her skills to provide for her family. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be known in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Three years ago she borrowed from Kashf Foundation for the first time to purchase required materials. Now she requested another loan worth 35,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads and packs of sequins and beads in various colors. She expects to increase her earnings and desires to spend a part of it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads and packs of sequins and beads in various colors

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas de 26 años es una mujer muy abnegada y trabajadora, comparte una vida conyugal con Carlos de 30 años y tiene una principal fuente de motivación que es su pequeño Anderson de 7 años y Yerenin de 1 añito. Vive junto a su familia en una vivienda construida a base de adobe. Desde joven siempre se desempeño en actividades agropecuarias concernientes al cultivo de café  y cacao orgánico, no obstante con motivo de brindarle a sus pequeño Anderson mayor atención optó junto a Carlos en abrir una tienda de abarrotes  en el primer piso de su vivienda.
Lleva 3 años en el negocio y hasta hoy ha logrado desempeñarlo al punto de convertirlo en un buen sustento adicional para su economía familiar.
Considera su negocio como un trabajo tranquilo y a su vez entretenido y esto le ha permitido ser muy conocida a su vez querida en su barrio. No obstante el alza de los precios de los productos que en muchas ocasiones disminuyen sus ventas.
Sus planes a largo plazo apuntan a  iniciar la construcción de su vivienda  a base de material noble que espera hacerlo en beneficio de sus pequeños. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, se siente muy agradecida con la oportunidad brindada la cual espera sacarle el máximo provecho en beneficio de su negocio.
Para esta primera ocasión requiera contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, conservas y bebidas gaseosas que son muy solicitados por su clientela.
texts.en:
Felicitas, age 26, is a very selfless and hard-working woman.  She shares a married life with 30 year old Carlos.  Her main source of motivation is her little seven year old Anderson and one year old Yerenin.  She lives with her family in an adobe home.  Ever since she was a young woman she has always worked in farming activities related to coffee and organic cacao.  

Nevertheless, with the intention of giving her little Anderson more attention, she chose to open a grocery store, together with Carlos, on the first floor of her house.  She has been in the business for three years.  So far she has managed to develop it into a good additional financial support for her family.

She feels that her business is peaceful yet entertaining work.  This has allowed her to become very well-known and dear to her neighborhood.  However, the rise in prices for the products many times decreases her sales.

Her long term plans are to start building her house out of substantial material.  She hopes to do so to benefit her two little ones.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very grateful for the opportunity that has been provided, and she hopes to take maximum advantage of it to benefit her business.

This first time she needs to have 1,000 soles to buy merchandise for her business.  She will buy things like rice, sugar, canned goods, and soft drinks.  These items are in high customer demand.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned goods, and soft drinks, which are in high customer demand.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Rosibel es una madre ejemplar, trabaja fuertemente para darle a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida, ella vende ropa en un local que acondicionó en su casa y ya tiene una importante cantidad de clientes que le impulsan a seguir adelante con este negocio, su esfuerzo ha hecho que su clientela aumente y por eso necesita tener un amplio surtido de mercadería para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Solicita un crédito por cuatrocientos mil colones (¢400.000)para comprar mercadería y surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Rosibel is an exemplary mother who works hard to give her children a good quality of life.  She sells clothing in a shop that she created in her house, and has a large number of customers who have motivated her to move ahead with this business.  He efforts have resulted in an increased number of customers, for which she needs a larger inventory in order to meet their needs.  She is requesting a loan of four hundred thousand colones (400,000) to buy merchandise and supply her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza De Pasacoguin 1 Group

texts.es:
La señora Felipa Rosalinda esta casada, tiene  35 años de edad, cursó los 2 años de educación primaria, tiene 7 hijos y 3 de ellos esta estudiando, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos, específicamente la crianza de pollos y cerdos, inicio este negocio por necesidad de superarse económicamente, hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que sera invertido para la compra de pollos de engorde, ya que quiere tener una granjita con varios animales. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio, crianza de animales y artesanía.
texts.en: Felipa Rosalinda is married and is 35 years old.  She completed 2 years of primary education.  She has 7 children, 3 of whom are in school.  She works raising domestic animals, specifically raising chickens and pigs.  She began this activity due to the necessity to get ahead economically.  She has 10 years of experience and has the support of her husband, who works in trade.  She organized a group in order to request a loan, which will be invested in buying chickens for fattening, as she would like to have a small farm with various animals.  The majority of members work in trade, raising animals and in handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy domestic animals.

loans.name: Edilbero

texts.en:
Edilberto is married with seven children. Edilberto is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Edilberto is a farmer and grows rubber trees to earn a living. He has been doing this for eight years. He has requested a loan to finance his rubber plantation such as fertilizers, new seedlings, maintenance. 
Edilberto has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To finance rubber tree plantation ( fertilizers, seedlings )

loans.name: Lone

texts.en: Lone is 28 years old and married with one child. She plans to start a business selling Samoan oil, printed materials, etc. She has requested a loan to buy more supplies to be sold at her flea market. Lone will use her profits to extend her business. She became a member of SPBD this year..

loans.use: to buy a new materials, paints, and empty bottles..

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Ms. Jamila is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of making and selling ‘Pakora.’  Pakora is a dish consisting of pieces of vegetable and chicken dipped in a gram flour or besan. She is an expert at making good tasting pakoras and earns enough through this business to contribute to the family income. In order to increase her sales she needs to purchase a stock of gram flour, packs of oil, salt and spices. For this she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKRs. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of her revenue on providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of gram flour, packs of oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: new materials, paints, paint brushes..

loans.name: Akbari

texts.en:
Ms Akbari is a 31-year-old married woman and has been in the carpet manufacturing business for the past 15 years. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs, and she has become known for providing good quality products in her community. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family, and trying hard to fulfill their needs including food, health, clothing, and education.

She has been in association with Kashf foundation for four years.  Currently she is applying for a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers,  etc.  She expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales and wishes to spend a part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers, etc.

loans.name: Mushinaka Group

texts.en:
Mushinaka is a group of 10 farmers in Kakamega south District represented by Elizabeth. The group has 5 women and 5 men. Elizabeth is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Elizabeth joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Elizabeth joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer, and because One Acre Fund has good planting time.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize per 1 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 17 bags per 1 acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. Elizabeth’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season.  In total they will receive inputs for 5 acres of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed products for her variety store. Her store is in their house and it has been running for three years now. As a widow, she works hard to provide income for her everyday expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda hopes that her business will grow and expand even more. She dreams of being rich. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their life and businesses every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Segundo Javier

texts.es:
En el centro de la Sierra ecuatoriana, cerca de la selva y en medio del campo, se encuentra Pastaza, un cantón ubicado en la Provincia con el mismo nombre, perteneciente a la Región Amazónica de la República del Ecuador. Ciudad que aun conservando espacios verdes, forma parte de la zona urbana de la ciudad. La cabecera cantonal es la ciudad del Puyo con 924 m. sobre el nivel del mar. Es demográficamente pequeña pero tiene una gran variedad de sitios que son los preferidos para turistas nacionales e internacionales sobre todo los de actividades ecológicas y de deportes extremos. Una ciudad que crece económicamente cada día por las actividades de comercio, ganadería, agricultura y turismo, que pretenden aprovechar cada oportunidad para ser el sustento de sus pobladores. En cada negocio se encuentra personas que no se han dado por vencidas frente a la falta de empleo sino que han emprendido con sus ideas de negocio para llevar una vida digna y hacer realidad sus sueños como es el caso de Segundo, un joven que con 24 años de edad ha forjado su camino para salir adelante, él terminó la escuela primaria y es por esto que tuvo dificultades en conseguir empleo. Es soltero y tiene muchas expectativas sobre su futuro.
Segundo desde hace 4 años adecuó su terreno para producir caña de azúcar y criar cerdos para su posterior comercialización. Aprendió con el ejemplo de sus padres quienes siempre esforzados, hicieron esta labor para sacar adelante su familia y tener cada día la cobertura de sus necesidades. Cada día invierte 10 horas en el cuidado de los cultivos y de los animales, además del aseo de los criaderos y la venta de sus productos. Este hombre sin duda emprendedor, quiere que su negocio crezca y así darse a conocer en toda la zona, para lo cual ha solicitado un préstamo que lo utilizará en la compra de cerdos bebés para poder continuar con su negocio, pues tiene que reemplazar los que se han vendido y además dar un paso de crecimiento al negocio aumentando los criaderos para así ofertar más animales. A Segundo se le ha dificultado la obtención de capital en las instituciones financieras, sin embargo agradece a Kiva por su intervención para que varias personas alrededor del mundo puedan formar parte de su sueño.
texts.en:
Pastaza is located in the center of the ecuadorian highlands, near the rainforest and in the middle of the countryside. This canton belongs to the province of the same name, which belongs to the Republic of Ecuador's amazonic region. It is an urban area, but the town still preserves its green areas. The city of Puyo is the largest in the canton, located 924 meters above sea level. It is demographically small, but there is a great variety of sites which are preferred tourist destinations for domestic and international visitors, especially those related to ecological activities and extreme sports. The city's economy is growing daily, due to commercial activity, ranching, farming, and tourism. Every opportunity is seized for these activities to support its inhabitants. In every business there are people who have not given up in the face of unemployment and have started their own business ventures in order to earn a decent living and make their dreams come true. 

That is the case of Segundo, a young man who at the age of 24 has made a way for himself in order to get ahead. After he finished primary school, he had difficulty finding work, so four years ago, he adapted his land to the production of sugarcane and the raising of pigs to sell. He learned from his parents' example. They always worked hard in this business in order to raise their family and cover their daily needs. Segundo is single, and has high expectations for his future.

He is undoubtedly an enterprising man. He invests ten hours per day in tending to his crops and animals, as well as in cleaning up the pigsties and selling his products. He wants his business to grow so that he can become known in his whole area, which is why he has requested a loan. He will use it to purchase baby pigs so that he can continue with his business, because he must replace the ones that are sold. He will also take another step towards expanding his business, which is to increase his pigsties so that he can offer more animals. Segundo has had a hard time obtaining capital from financial institutions, so he is grateful to Kiva for intervening so that people all over the world are able to live their dreams.

loans.use: to buy baby pigs and expand his pigsties.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been manufacturing buckles for the past eight years which are used in the embellishment of shoes. She makes beautiful buckles at home and then sells them in the local market.  At this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demands of her customers she requested a loan of  30,000 PKR to purchase threads, sequins and pearls in various colors to increase her production. She hopes to boost her earnings through increased sales. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Razia wishes to utilize part of the revenues to provide good and quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase threads, sequins and pearls in various colors to increase her production

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura desde muy joven, en compañía de su padre; pues proviene de una familia muy numerosa y tenia que trabajar junto con sus hermanos varones. A los 17 años de edad se caso y continuo trabajando en la agricultura junto con su esposo, desde hace 9 años empezó a comprar y vender ganado siempre con su esposo. Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a cuatro kilómetros de su casa y para trasladar los insumos debe pagar un medio de trasporte. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más ganado y comercializar con él; con el propósito de obtener más ingresos económicos para suplir las necesidades de su familia. Él desea terminar de construir su casa y proporcionar a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: Maria, 39, is married and has four children. She has worked in agriculture from a young age alongside her father. She comes from a very large family and she had to work alongside her brothers. She got married at 17 and continued to work in agriculture with her husband. Nine years ago, she began to buy and sell livestock, always with her husband. She buys farming supplies in a city four kilometers from her home and and she has to pay to transport them. The loan she is asking from Fundación Campo is to buy more livestock, and sell it. The goal is to earn more income to meet her family's needs. She hopes to finish building to house and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy more livestock and sell it.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota, es una sencilla comerciante de 53 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, casada, madre de tres hijos de 27,21 y 15 años de edad respectivamente. Ella se dedica a atender una pulpería, negocio que inicio después que regreso de Costa Rica , cuando trabajo de doméstica en ese país. Actualmente vive de la pulpería, su esposa le ayuda con los ingresos que el gana como albañil. Vende a diario leche, huevo, pan, avenas, café, pues con la temporada escolar su clientela desde tempranas horas está buscando productos para el desayuno de sus hijos.
Está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar azúcar, aceite, granos básicos , enlatados , jabón detergentes , leña, fósforos , avenas , jugos. Uno de sus aspiraciones es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, comprar estantes y vitrinas para mantenerla llenas de productos alimenticios en su pulpería.
texts.en: Carlota, 53, is a simple businesswoman who lives in the city of Granada. She is married and has three children, ages 27, 21, and 15. She works in a small grocery store, a business that she started when she returned from Costa Rica, where she worked as a maid. She currently lives off of the grocery store. Her husband helps her with the money he makes as a construction worker. She sells milk, eggs, bread, oats, and coffee daily. Early in the morning during the school year, her customers are looking for products for their childrens' breakfasts. She is asking for the financing to buy sugar, oil, grains, canned goods, soap, detergent, firewood, matches, oats, and juices. One of her dreams is to improve the structure of her house, and to buy shelves and display cases to keep full of food products in her store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, grains, canned goods, soap, detergent, firewood, matches, oats, and juices.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Ms. Zahida is a 48-year-old married woman.  She has been running a business of crockery sales for many years. She offers various products such as dinner sets, tea sets, and bowls, etc. Her husband works as a driver and earns insufficient income to meet the needs of the family members alone, so  Zahida makes sufficient income to contribute to the family's income. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for  loan of 20,000 PKRs. In this way she will be able to purchase a variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a hard working women. Florence is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small business, in which she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, will help Florence to generate greater profits, to buy basic needs for her family, and also to save for future use. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her capital. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Tiuana

texts.en: Tiuana is a 39-year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business.Tiuana needs a loan to to buy a new frying pan, a sack of flour, vegetable oil, etc. She plans to use her profits to help her with family needs. Tiuana has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new frying pan, cooking oil, flour, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Rashidan

texts.en: Ms. Rashidan is a 47-year-old married woman and a loving mother of seven children: four daughter and three sons. The man shown in the photo is Rashidan’s husband who has been running a vehicle repair shop for the past 25 years.  For the improvement of her husband’s business, Rashidan has applied for a loan of 15,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. In this way her husband will be able to purchase a new welding machine for his workshop to cater his customers needs, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She dreams of providing a good quality education for her children so they may have a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new welding machine for her husband's workshop

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 64-year-old married man from Ndunyu Njeru.  He has grown up children.

Joseph has a butcher business that he has been running for many years.  He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD., to enable him to buy small bulls for fattening, and later to slaughter them for meat to sell in his butcher shop.

He hopes to continue doing business and thus gain a lot of experience from it.

loans.use: to buy small bulls for fattening then slaughter

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 54-year-old married woman with one child, living in Ndunyu Njeru.  She has owned and managed a housing rental business for the last two years.  She is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to help her to buy sheets of iron to renovate her rental houses. 

Mary hopes to be the  leading business woman in her area in the near future

loans.use: To buy sheets of iron

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 1 Group

texts.en:
Ni Made lives with her husband and her children are still in school.  Ni Made is helping her husband's income (he works as a farmer) by running a pig business at her home.

In order to expand her business, Ni Made raised capital by way of joining the group Karanjung Lestari 1, where she was also chosen by the other members as the head of the group and works together with MUK to get business loans for pig farmers.

With the loan of 3.5 million IDR per person, Ni Made is planning to buy 4 piglets with the price of 500,000 IDR each. Although the price of feed is currently very expensive, Ni Made expects the later sale of four pigs would gain an advantage of over 500.000 IDR per month and can increase the income of her husband to support her family and help her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Elukhambi Group

texts.en:
Juliet is pictured on the right with her hand raised among her Elukhambi Group members. The 10 of them, all women, are farmers in Kakamega south District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Juliet joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Juliet joined One Acre Fund so that she could access the best input prices and gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer. 

Juliet reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 1.5 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 5 bags per 1/2 acre!  She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and save for enough food security. Juliet’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 5 acres of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a happy business man after investing in his bicycle repairs shop. He began his store with about $115, and he says the value of the business is growing in line with the market. The main challenge of running the shop has been the high cost of stocks, but Solomon is up to the task.

He has therefore asked for a loan of 99,050 Kenyan shillings (KES) to pay for new stocks of bicycle spares and new parts. Solomon wants to invest the extra income generated into other businesses, hopefully setting up a retail shop dealing in clothes, household items like basins, and cooking utensils.

loans.use: to add to his stock of retail items such as bicycle parts for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a piece of land to build a house for his  family

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 30 years old. She is married and has one child who is seven years old.  Her husband is her partner. She has been in business for four years selling shoes. She wants a loan to buy more shoes to sell.  The profits earned will be used towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 35 years old, and he lives in Kutaisi district with his wife, parents-in-law and four-year-old daughter. Zaza works as a baker at the local bakery, and his father-in-law is an operator at the petrol station. Both of them earn a monthly salary. 

Zaza has asked for a loan from local financial institutions several times to start up a family business, but he hasn't had any success. He wants to start his own bakery, but his loan requests have always been rejected in the past because of his lack of experience, which is usually required by local credit providers. 

Zaza has now been approved for a loan by a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program is designed to provide business start-up and re-startup loans with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to traditional credit products. These rural poor are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his loan, Zaza plans to start his own bakery. He will bake traditional Georgian bread and sell it for a good price. He hopes his project will be profitable as he already has good baking experience, and will offer quality products to his customers. He thinks this will increase his sales volume. The new business, financed by the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to start up a bakery

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a responsible mother who aims to become financially stable in order to give her family a better life. She is 38 years old and has four school-age children. 

Edna owns and manages a small variety store to earn additional income. Due to the high cost of school fees, she aims to strengthen the business to generate a higher income. Due to financial insufficiency, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional stocks of snack foods, beverages, seasonings, soaps, noodles, canned goods, and herbicides to sell. 

Edna is hoping that someday she will improve the business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of snack foods, beverages, seasonings, soaps, noodles, canned goods, and herbicides to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 47 years old. She is married and has six children. The oldest is 17 years old and the youngest is eight months. Her husband is her partner in the business. She has been in business for two years selling milk. She wants a loan to buy more milk to sell. With the profits she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more liters of milk for sale.

loans.name: Verdianne

texts.en: Verdianne is 27 years old. She is married and has three children. The oldest is five and the youngest is two. Her husband is a motorcyclist. She has been in business for four years selling beans, potatoes, and bananas. She wants a loan to buy more of these products.  The profits earned will be put towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans, potatoes, and bananas to sell

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 32 years old. She is married and has six children. The oldest is 11 years old and the youngest is six months. Her husband is a builder. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, and soap. The profits will go towards her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rice, cooking oil, and soap for sale.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet's is a hard working women. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 3 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her salon, in which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy dryers for the salon, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and take good care of her child. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a training center. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy dryers for the salon

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has been selling spare parts, he also ventured into private transport business which has been earning him extra income for the past ten years with a monthly income of 50,000 KES which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his third loan term with KADET LTD., after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan and savings accumulated to buy a private vehicle for transport services which will enable him to increase his income. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he reinvest it into the business. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children and improve on the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a private vehicle for transport services

loans.name: Zoidjon

texts.ru:
Зоидчон родился в 1978 году , в сельской местности, в семье со средним достатком.  Зоидчон женатый человек и имеет одного ребенка.   Супруга его  не работает, так как находится в декретном отпуске.  Зоидчон с супругой проживают в родительском доме с родителями. Родители его являются пенсионерами .   
 С маленьких лет помогал своему отцу по уходу за крупно  рогатым скотом. Этой деятельностью он занимается, и по сей день.  Покупка и разведения скота. Он покупает скот ,разводит  его , а потом снова выводит их на продажу на местный рынок. 
Кредит он запрашивает для покупки корма для скота. Он выражает свою благодарность "Кива" за финансовую  поддержку в трудную минуту.
texts.en:
Zoidjon was born in 1978 to a middle-class family living in the country. He's now married and has one kid. His wife is currently on maternity leave. They live in the countryside with their pensioner parents. 
Since childhood, Zoidjon has helped his father take care of their cattle. This experience helps him run his cattle breeding business. He buys cattle, breeds it, then sells it at the local market. Zoidjon is asking for a loan in order to purchase some fodder for his cattle. 
He thanks Kiva for helping him in this tough moment.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 4 femmes dont 3 mariées, les membres de groupe Badeya vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le  commerce, d’encens, de bois de chauffe et de pagnes wax-bazins. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 12ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame ASTAN (1ère assise à droite sur la photo) est la vendeuse de wax et bazins. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 4pièces de pagnes wax et 2 pièces de pagnes bazins. 
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame ASTAN compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Badeya group has four female members, three of whom are married and most of whom live in traditional families. Their average age is 33, and they have an average of two children each. They all live in Sikasso (the third-largest administrative region in Mali), and know each other through marriage, because they are related, or because they live close to one another.

The group’s members work in retail selling incense, firewood and wax pagnes [traditional wrap-around cloth] and damask. In order to increase their working capital, they joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 12th group loan cycle. Astan, who is seated first on the right in the photo, works selling wax pagnes and damask. She plans to use her loan to buy four lengths of wax pagnes and two lengths of damask pagnes. Astan gets her supplies from wholesalers, and her sales are made on a retail basis (in cash and on credit) from her home and at market. Her customers are both male and female. With this loan, she hopes to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA, which she will reinvest in her business and also use to help her husband with certain family expenses.

loans.use: To buy wax pagne-style cloth and damask.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 27 years old. She is married and has two children. The oldest is five and the youngest is one. Her husband sells cloth. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more rice, cooking oil, and soaps to sell. She will put the profits towards her savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, and soaps for sale

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny, es casado y tiene dos hijos, que están en etapa escolar, viven en una casa en anticretico ocupando dos habitaciones pequeñas, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Armonía de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas como guardia de seguridad en un súper mercado, ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar los estudios de actualización en el curso de seguridad ya que le será de mucha ayuda en su trabajo para mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Jhonny es tener casa propia para brindar seguridad y comodidad a su familia.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jhonny is married and has two school-age children.  They live in two small rooms in an "anticrético" [a rental arrangement in which the rent is paid up front].  The house is located in the Villa Armonía section of the city of La Paz.

Currently he works more than eight hours as a security guard in a supermarket.  It's the only job that covers his education expenses, food, and basic services for his family.

He needs the loan to pay for refresher studies in the security course.  It will be a lot of help to him in his job to improve his income.

Jhonny's dream is to have his own house to give security and comfort to his family.

This is the third time he's working with IMPRO and the first with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a refresher course in security

loans.name: Melidah

texts.en:
Melidah's group is comprised of hard working women. Melidah is 23 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Melidah has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells raw food. 

To help expand her business, Melidah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food such as bananas and cassava to sell, and will help Melidah generate greater profit and support her family with their basic needs. Melidah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Melidah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more raw food such as bananas and cassava to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 33 years old. He is married with one child. His wife sells goods in a store. He has been in business for one year as a restaurant owner. He wants a loan to buy food for his restaurant. With the profit he will put it towards his savings.

loans.use: To buy more food for use in his restaurant.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 36 years old. She is married with four children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest is two. Her husband is a driver. She has been in business for two years. She wants a loan to buy more goods for her store such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, and soap. With the profit she will add to her savings.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her store for resale.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is a 30-year-old married mother of four children ranging in age from nine years to two months. Her husband sells cloth. Francine has operated a food market for 12 years and is requesting a loan to buy more potatoes, bananas, and beans to sell. With the profit she will build a house.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, beans and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Evojo Group

texts.en:
Arthur, a member of Evojo Group in Kakamega south District, is pictured with 13 One Acre Fund farmers, consisting of three women and ten men. Arthur, who is standing on the right in the photo with his hand raised, is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. A new One Acre Fund farmer and excited for the 2013 Long Rains season, he joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and use any increased profits to send his children to school and save for the future.

Arthur described his harvest last year as poor. He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer he is able to join the ranks of those who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. Arthur’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 6.5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school fees

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 35 years old. She is married with four children. The oldest is 16 and the youngest is seven. Her husband is a driver. She has been in business for six years, selling different items in her boutique. With the loan, she wants to buy more lotions, cooking oil and soap for sale. The profit will go towards the children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more lotions, cooking oil and soap for sale.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is happy to have joined Milango. He has witnessed growth in his business but he is faced with the challenge reliable transportation for transporting his goods. Benard is therefore asking for a loan of 41,850 to buy a motorcycle to transport goods to and from the market. He believes this will enable him to reach more customers. He plans to use the extra income from this to open other types businesses.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en: Faustin, a 63-year-old whose children range in age from 25 to 18 years, is married to a farmer. In the business of selling liquor for four years, Faustin is requesting a loan to buy more alcohol to sell. The profit will go toward his savings.

loans.use: To buy more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.en:
Philip is a member of Baraka Group in Kakamega South District. He is pictured with 17 One Acre Fund farmers, 13 women and 4 men. Philip is standing on the right, with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for 0.5 acres of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. 

Philip first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Philip joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Philip reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about eight bags of maize per 1.5 acres, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 15 bags per acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to invest in livestock and save for the future. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Baraka Group members will take input loans of 0.5 acres each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 8.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is 61 years old from Sagarejo district, East Georgia. She gets orders to sew on a machine. In addition, she has a vineyard and sells grapes seasonally. Nunu requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for the family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nunu requested a loan from Credo for start-up business. Her loan request was approved by a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the approved loan Nunu will purchase a cow for milking and will build a shed. Nunu plans to produce dairy products and thus increase her income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for milk

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 30 years old. She is married and has two children. The oldest is five and the youngest is two. Her husband works at RFTC as a driver. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more food goods for her store. The profits will go towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy more food products to sell

loans.name: Wedidah

texts.en:
Wedidah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Wedidah has been working hard to manage her small store, which sells cosmetic body lotions. 

To help expand her business, Wedidah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more body lotions to sell, and will help Wedidah generate greater profits.  She will use the profts to pay the school fees for her child. Wedidah hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses of her own. 

Wedidah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more body lotions to sell

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame, a resident of Mariakani, Kenya, is a married mother of five children who has been operating a cafe for five years. Her main challenge is fluctuating demand.

Dzame was introduced to Milango by her friends and is requesting a loan of 62,650 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, flour, frying oil, cereals etc. She plans to save the extra income for her children's education and to open a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, oil, cereals etc.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 43 years old. She is married, with three children. The oldest is 18 and the youngest is nine. Her husband is unemployed. She has been in business for ten years. She wants a loan to buy more food goods for sale. With the profits, she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more food goods for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 29 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is seven and the youngest is three. Her husband is a mechanic. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more potatoes, rice, bananas, and tomatoes to sell.  She will put the profits towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, rice, and bananas to sell

loans.name: Alejandro Rafael
