This is why she is seeking a loan to buy cement, bricks, Duralita [type of fiber cement roofing material] and so on. The young woman has good credit references and is very responsible. She promises to repay the loan and is also confident that she will provide her small home with financial security.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and Duralita.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Siempre las personas buscan superarse no importa el momento en que lo hagan y un caso de esos es el de esta joven mujer, ya que ella tiene grandes habilidades es honesta, emprendedora y muy trabajadora comprometida con las metas que se ha propuesto a cumplir. Vive con su grupo familiar el cual es su principal fuente de inspiración. Desde hace un tiempo tiene una pequeña pupusería en su lugar de residencia y gracias a la calidad, los buenos precios y el servicio las personas la prefieren y la tienen como una opción confiable para sus compras, tiene poco tiempo con el negocio pero desea seguir impulsándolo, quiere comprar mayor cantidad de materiales pues asi aumentara la producción y por lo tanto las ventas, pero no posee el capital suficiente para hacerlo, es por eso que solicita un credito que le permita comprar maíz, frijol, chicharrón, queso, verduras entre otros. El cliente posee un buen récord crediticio y cuenta con la satisfacción de que nunca le ha quedado mal a nadie ya que es muy responsable, agradece desde ya el apoyo que le brinden y al mismo tiempo confía en la esperanza de que pronto podrá ofrecerle una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
People are always looking to succeed no matter the time involved doing it and this is the case of this young woman, as she has great accomplishments and is honest, enterprising and hardworking committed to the goals that she has set to accomplish.

She lives in a family unit which is her main source of inspiration. For some time she has had a small grocery store in her home and thanks to the quality, the good prices and the service people prefer her and they have a dependable source for their purchases. She has been in the business a short time but she wants to continue fostering it. She wants to buy more supplies so she can increase the production and thus the sales, but she does not have enough capital to do it and this is why she is asking for a loan to permit her to buy corn, beans, pork rinds, cheese, vegetables and more.

She has a good credit history and has the satisfaction of knowing that she has never hurt anyone and is always responsible, and is thankful for the help she has been given and at the same time she has confidence in the hope that soon she will be able to offer a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, pork rinds, cheese and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Es un hombre emprendedor y comprometido con deseos de superación y con muchas posibilidades de hacer algo grande con su vida, su mayor deseo es entregarle un mejor futuro a su familia buscando tener nuevos horizontes y olvidándose de la delincuencia que los rodea. Tiene un grupo familiar por el cual se esfuerza día a día, es muy trabajador y desde hace un tiempo se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, el poco tiempo que le ha dedicado a la agricultura le ha regalado experiencia que le permite realizar una buena labor y además le da la oportunidad de obtener buenas ganancias, se siente orgulloso porque ha logrado que le dé buenos resultados,  el terreno de cultivo le da las mejores cosechas por eso los clientes lo prefieren por calidad, buen precio y excelente servicio; su meta es tener mejores beneficios que le ayuden a cumplir sus sueños. Él tiene la convicción de que si aumenta sus ventas así aumentarán las ganancias, es por eso que se solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de frijol, maíz, herbicida, abonos, etc. Agradece la colaboración que recibirá además tiene esperanza en Dios que no lo abandonara y podrá cancelar la deuda,  además tiene la certeza que asi podrá  darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
He is an enterprising man, and he is committed to his desire for self-improvement and the many opportunities to do something big with his life.  His biggest wish is to give his family a better future as he looks to new horizons, forgetting about the crime that surrounds them.  

He puts forth great effort day to day for his family.  He is very hard-working, and he has been growing corn and beans for some time.  The small amount of time he has spent on farming has gifted him with experience that allows him to do good work.  It also gives him the opportunity to get good income.  

He is proud because he has managed for the crops to give him good results.  The land he farms gives him the best harvests.  That is why the customers prefer him for the quality, good price, and excellent service.  His goal is to have better profits that will help him fulfill his dreams.

He has the conviction that if he increases his sales he will increase the income.  That is why he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy bean and corn seeds, herbicide, and manure, etc.  He is grateful for the help that he will receive.  He also has the hope that God will not abandon him, and that he will be able to repay the debt.  He is also certain that this way he will be able to give his family the quality of life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy bean and corn seeds, herbicide, and manure.

loans.name: Tanzanite Group

texts.en:
From Tujijenge Tanzania, Asha, who is in her late 40s, is a married mother of four children, two of whom are in school. For a period of six years now, Asha has been operating a restaurant, offering a variety of food services (breakfast, lunch and sometimes supper). She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Asha's 16th loan. She used the previous loans, all since repaid, to purchase a plot of land upon which she hopes to build a house, bought bed mattresses, a sofa set, and a cupboard for clothes. She also paid household expenses as well as school fees. She is now requesting a loan to buy more food stocks and items for her restaurant business.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group " Tanzanite," composed of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food stocks and items for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Mujer con triunfos y derrotas pero con la idea de mejorar su vida y la de su familia. Ella reside con su grupo familiar en zona con alta violencia social del país, día a día debe lidiar con ella para no verse arrastrada y afectada por la difícil situación; los miembros de su hogar son la razón de que ella se esmere para brindarles lo que se merecen. Se dedica a vender pollos de engorde en un lugar que califico como excelente para sus actividades comerciales, desde hace un tiempo se ha hecho de personas que la buscan por la calidad de las aves y por el buen servicio siempre a la orden de los clientes.  Actualmente ella tiene el deseo de mejorar en el negocio y quiere realizar una nueva inversión por lo que solicita un crédito que le permita comprar pollos por mayor, concentrado, etc. Esta segura que con la ayuda recibida podrá brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia y también confía en Dios que pronto saldara de la deuda adquirida. Agradece de ante mano la ayuda que recibirá y cuenta con la satisfacción de que es muy capaz de realizar todo aquello que se proponga.
texts.en: This is a woman who has seen many triumphs and defeats but she keeps in mind her plan of improving her and her family's life.  She lives with her family in an area of the country that has a lot of social violence.  Every day she must fight so that she is not dragged down or affected by the difficult situation.  The people at home are the reason she works hard, so she can give them what they deserve.  This woman works selling fattened chickens in a place that is excellent for this kind of work.  For some time now she has had people coming looking for her because of the quality of birds offered and for the good, personal service she gives to customers.  She currently wants to improve her business and invest more money.  For this, she is applying for a loan that will allow her to buy chickens in bulk and feed, etc.  She is sure that with this help she will be able to provide her family with a better future and she trusts in God that she will soon be able to pay off this debt.  She says thank you in advance for the help she will receive and she is satisfied that she is capable of doing whatever she puts her mind to.

loans.use: to buy chickens in bulk and feed.

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.es:
El Señor danilo jose   de 45 años, es originario de la ciudad de Chinandega, residente en el Municipio de Somotillo, caracterizado por ser un buen trabajador dedicado a su familia y a su profesión, amante a la labor que realiza, ha sabido manejar su condición de vida, casado con 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta y fabricación de medicina natural, cuenta con un negocio propio. 

Actualmente se presento a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materia prima, miel de abeja, envases, frascos, capsulas, esencias, etiquetas, para la fabricación de su producto e incrementar su negocio y de esta manera mejorar su capital.
texts.en:
Mr. Danilo Jose is 45 years old. He comes from the city of Chinandega and lives in the town of Somotillo. He's known to be a good worker who's dedicated to his family and his trade. He loves the work that he does and has known how to manage his living conditions. He's married and has two children. He runs his own business manufacturing and selling natural medicines.
He recently approached Ceprodel in order to request a loan. With it he'll purchase supplies such as bee honey, bottles, jars, capsules, extracts and labels in order to make his products. That way he'll boost his business and therefore increase his capital.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as bee honey, bottles, jars, capsules, extracts and labels in order to make medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang was born in 1982. She has a little son and a nine-year-old daughter. Her husband is a carpenter and earns about 10,000,000 VND per month. Hang is also a carpenter. Her income is about 8,000,000 VND. She has done this job for ten years. Her family’s total earnings are about 18,000,000 VND per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She wants to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai was born in 1976. She has three children. Her son is a student in primary school. Her two daughters are students in secondary school. Her husband is a carpenter and earns about 8,000,000 VND per month. Hang is also a carpenter. Her income is about 7,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 15 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 15,000,000 VND per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She wants to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Isabel Segunda

texts.es: Isabel se dedica al comercio de carnes frías, negocio al que ha agregado prendas de acero y de plata. Ella con esta actividad ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 8 y 13 años. Su idea de negocio nació favoreciendo su necesidad de generar ingresos propios, que ayudaran especialmente en el gasto de sus hijos quienes en la medida que crecen, tiene muchas mas necesidades que demandan gastos.  Este fue su propósito impulsado por su cónyuge, quien  trabaja como contratista en una empresa importante de la región. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del sector, que acuden a satisfacer sus necesidades de buena imagen lo cual  complementan con  los accesorios que Isabel vende. Así mismo este mismo mercado accede a embutidos, como  butifarras, salchichas, salchichón, entre otros que compra en el mercado de la ciudad y que ayudan mucho a generar nuevos  ingresos, que hacen que cada vez su vida y la de su familia tenga mayor calidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará anillos de plata, cadenas de acero, pulseras y carnes frías, para responder a la demanda de su clientela, de quienes han hecho ya su preventa. Con su anterior crédito ha dado una mayor diversidad a su negocio y mayor estabilidad, por eso no duda en cumplir su sueño de ofrecerles los mejores niveles de educación a sus hijos, porque este es justamente el gran desafío que ella y su cónyuge tienen y que les da sentido a su vida.
texts.en: Isabel sells cold meats but she has also added selling stainless steel and silver jewelry to her first business. She has been able to see her family advance in life thanks to this economic activity. She has two children with her partner, ages 8 and 13. Her business idea was born out of the necessity to generate her own income, in particular to help care for her children who, as they grow, have many more needs that require more money. Her husband, who works as a contractor for a business in the area, was the one who motivated her to get started. Her principal customers are her neighbors in the area who complement their good looks with the accessories that Isabel sells. In the same market, she also sells sausages like Butifarra (Catalan style sausage), salchichas (sausage), salchichón (a salami-like sausage), among other kinds of meats she purchases in the city market, which helps her to generate new sources of income that makes her life, and that of her family, that much better. She is currently applying for a loan with kiva and her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, she will purchase silver rings, stainless steel chains, bracelets and cold meats, in order to respond to her customer's demand, who have already put in orders. With her previous loan, she was able to add more diversity to her products and create more stability, and so, she has no doubt that she will be able to achieve her dream of offering better levels of education to her children; this is the biggest challenge that she and her partner have and it gives meaning to their lives.

loans.use: purchase silver rings, stainless steel chains, bracelets and cold meats.

loans.name: Salihu

texts.en:
Salihu is a master carver from Ghana who specializes in masks and sculptures. He would like to hire additional artisans for his workshop, as well as purchase larger amounts of wood and paint.

Salihu has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"Upon the death of my father, I was sent to live with one of my father's closest friends, a renowned traditional carver to the then Akwamu chief and the people of Akwamu. I worked with him for about 15 years, during which time I learned the styles and techniques of the Ashanti and Akwamu people. My work began to flourish and achieve recognition, and today, I have apprentice carvers working with me to learn the art of carving."

"With this microcredit loan I'll be able to increase the number of people working at my workshop. I thank you for taking part in this microcredit so that I may improve my business."

Use the link below to view Salihu's hand-carved wood masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3753

loans.use: to hire additional artisans for his workshop, as well as purchase larger amounts of wood and paint.

loans.name: Ketut

texts.en:
Bali's Ketut specializes in intricate hand-carved sculptures. To increase production, he would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of wood.

Ketut has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"It was my older brother, Made, who taught me to carve sculptures. I saved until I had enough to start my own workshop, and now I'm able to offer employment to other carvers from my village. Balinese culture and tradition inspire my artwork. As the son of a master carver, it is easy and enjoyable for me to transfer my imagination into my work. Through my art I do hope to provide a good life and a better future for my family, especially for my child.

"I am thankful for your support through this microcredit, because with it I'll be able to continue carving more sculptures. I believe that the more I make, the more I'll be able to sell and keep my workshop running."

Use the link below to view Ketut's hand-carved sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1724

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of wood

loans.name: Patrizia

texts.en:
Patrizia is an artisan in Guatemala who specializes in cotton and recycled rubber accessories. She would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of cotton gauze for production.

Patrizia has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"I was born in Italy, but I fell in love with Guatemala, its people and culture; which motivated me to settle here in 2001. I began meeting people in the world of fashion design and was fortunate to become friends with one of Guatemala's most famous designers, who has been like a mentor to me. I'm always observant of styles and trends in international fashions, which I've blended with the colors and traditions of Guatemala. I am very serious about helping the environment, so I also recycle fabrics and other materials.

"Many thanks for supporting Guatemalan arts and crafts. This microcredit offers us the opportunity to purchase larger amounts of materials to continue production."

Use the link below to view Patrizia's cotton and recycled rubber accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8082

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of cotton gauze for production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add retail stock, e.g., rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a master carver in Ghana who specializes in African masks and sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of wood, glue, sandpaper, and gas for his kiln.  

Ibrahim has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story:

"When I was a child, I had to leave school at a very young age due to our family's financial situation. Eventually I learnt the wood carvers' trade from my uncle. The greatest challenge I have faced is not having enough funds to purchase the materials I needed to work. My greatest motivation comes from people's admiration of my work – their comments inspire me to continue. I am now happily married, I enjoy my craft, and I share my expertise with the students I teach. I love this art form!"

"I say a big thank you to the people who make it possible for me to get the materials I need through this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Ibrahim's hand-carved wood masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7056

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood, glue, sandpaper, and gas for his kiln.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three school-going children. She owns a food café, a business which has been running for 11 years. The café mainly sells cooked food. She also earns some income from the rental houses owned by the family. The area has a high population, most of whom work in the Island and return to the mainland in the evenings and find little time to prepare meals.

Fatuma learnt about Milango through advertisements, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations. 

Fatuma is applying for a loan of 85,900 Kenya shillings (KES) to add retail and food stock, e.g., rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of her family and pay school fees for her children. She looks forward to owning/opening other cafes in the area.

loans.use: To add retail and food stock, e.g., rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen was born in 1981. She has two sons. Her older son is learning at secondary school. Her younger son is learning at primary school. Her husband is a driver and earns about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

Quyen is a farmer. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this job for ten years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2004. In the last cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, Quyen would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy food for her chickens. She always wants to build a new chicken coop.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa was born in 1961. She has two children who are adults. Her husband sells secondhand motorbikes to earn a living and earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. 

Thoa is a farmer. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 30 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

Thoa has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2004. In the last cycle, she borrowed 8,938,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,938,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Bikaje

texts.en:
Bikaje lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four school-going children. 

Bikaje owns a food café, a business which has been running for six years. The café mainly sells cooked food. She also earns some income from the rental houses owned by the family. The area has a high population, most of whom work on the island and return to the mainland in the evenings and find little time to prepare meals. Besides these, she also sells charcoal, clothes and fuel wood.

Bikaje learnt about Milango through advertisements, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations. 

Bikaje is applying for a loan of 32,600 Kenya shillings to add retail and food stock, e.g., charcoal, fuel wood, clothes, rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking fat, etc. 

The extra income from the loan will be added to Bikaje’s savings to improve on the living standard of her family and pay school fees for her children. She looks forward to owning/opening other cafés in the area.

loans.use: to buy retail/food stock, e.g., fuel wood, clothes, rice, cereals, wheat flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock of rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has six children, five of whom are in school. For the past 5 years, Jane has owned and run a food café, mainly selling cooked food. She also earns additional income from a water vending shop. Jane's spouse is employed and provides some income for the family.

Jane learned about Milango through a friend. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Jane's main challenges are bad debts and high rental fees. Jane is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to buy retail and food stock of rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. Jane will use the extra income from the loan for savings, to improve her family's living standards and to pay school fees for her children. She looks forward to owning/opening other cafes in the area.

loans.use: To buy retail and food stock of rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel, propietario de un restaurante, accedió en el pasado a un credikiva con el que compró menaje de cocina, mesas y sillas, ampliando la posibilidad de que nuevos clientes llegaran a su establecimiento y esto fue lo que justamente ocurrió. Hoy está muy satisfecho y por eso está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará, insumos para la preparación de alimentos, como arroz, aceite cárnico, con esta compra  espera ganar descuentos por hacerla de contado y en mayor volumen y obtendrá una reducción de sus costos que aumentarían sus utilidades y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión de Kiva. Desde que recibió su credikiva tiene más afluencia de público y ha mejorado sus ingresos familiares. Él dice a sus financiadores de Kiva “Gracias por haberme permitido mejorar mi negocio. “
texts.en:
Samuel, a restaurant owner, previously received a Kiva loan which he used to purchase kitchenware, tables and chairs, expanding the possibility that new customers might come to his establishment, and this is exactly what happened. 

Today he is very happy and for this reason he is applying for a new Kiva loan. With the new loan he will buy supplies for food preparation, such as rice and meat oil. With this purchase he hopes to gain discounts for purchasing in cash and in greater volume, thereby reducing his costs and increasing his profits - a direct result of your investment in Kiva. 

Since receiving his Kiva loan he has had a greater influx of customers and he has improved his family income. He says to his Kiva lenders, "Thank you for permitting me to improve my business."

loans.use: to buy supplies for food preparation, such as rice and meat oil

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 50 años, que vive junto a su esposo Antonio. Tiene 3 hijos, pero por ahora sólo vive con 1 de ellos. Su casa se ubica en un distrito rural. Con mucho entusiasmo, Yolanda menciona que su principal actividad económica desde hace 20 años es la agricultura, ya que con ella, hizo posible los pagos de los estudios superiores de sus hijos, los cuales le visitan constantemente y se siente feliz de tener el amor de sus nietos, a los que consiente mucho. 
Sus principales cultivos, son de flor de gladiolo, arvejas y papas, los que tenazmente cuida y abona; pues sabe que de eso depende la buena venta en cada cosecha, ya que vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, y dependiendo de la calidad, los lleva a la capital del país, donde le pagan mayor precio. 
“Sembrar arvejas y gladiolos es muy rentable, lo bueno es que se cosechan en 4, 5 o 6 meses”, menciona.
Las siembras no se detienen en su zona, por ello requiere de su ayuda para adquirir más semillas y bolsas de fertilizantes. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y esté es su crédito número 8 con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos.
Yolanda comprará 5 bolsas de semillas de arvejas, 2 de flores de gladiolos, lo restante será para adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en: Yolanda is 50 years old and lives with her husband, Antonio. They have three children, but only one lives with them. Their home is located in a rural district in Peru. With a lot of enthusiasm, Yolanda mentions that her main source of income for the past 20 years has been farming, and through her work she was able to pay for the higher education of her children, who visit her often. She is happy to have the love of her grandchildren, whom she admittedly spoils a lot. Her main crops are gladiolus flowers, peas and potatoes, and she vigorously cares for them because she depends on good sales every harvest. She sells the products in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, and, depending on the quality, she takes them to Lima, the capital, where they pay better prices. "Planting peas and gladiolus is very lucrative. The good thing is that they are harvested in four to six months," Yolanda says. The plantings never stop in her area, so she needs your help to acquire more seeds and bags of fertilizers. Yolanda belongs to "Picaflores de Patay" community bank, and this is her eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She hopes with all of your support she can continue with her objectives. She plans to purchase five bags of pea seeds and two of gladiolus seeds, and the rest will go toward bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase pea seeds, gladiolus flowers seeds and bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Liz Narcisa

texts.es: Liz compró materias primas con los cuales confeccionó uniformes escolares, respondiendo a la demanda de estos productos. Sus ventas se incrementaron pues cumplió oportunamente con los pedidos de su clientela y de allí que sus  ingresos mejoraran, para poder seguir confeccionando en diversas líneas. Liz envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecida, y ojalá nos sigan apoyando a nosotros los pequeñitos empresarios, para así seguir trabajando y poder realizar nuestros sueños. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva nuevamente con el que planea comprar telas, hilos, pues tiene un contrato para fabricar uniformes estudiantiles de diario y de educación física y deporte. Su inversión es exitosa porque la hace en el marco de su experiencia y los convenios que hace con los colegios y los padres de familia de los estudiantes.
texts.en: Liz bought supplies to sew school uniforms, responding to demand for those products. Her sales increased as she complied with her customers' orders, and thus her income also increased. In order to continue sewing a variety of product lines, Liz sent the following message to Kiva lenders: "I am very grateful and hopefully you continue to support our small businesses so we can keep working and be able to realize our dreams." She is currently requesting a new Kiva loan with the plan to purchase fabrics and thread because she has a contract to make school uniforms for daily use and for physical education. Your investment will be successful because it will add to her experience and help in making deals with schools and parents of students.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread and various supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four school-going children. She owns a retail business which sells cleaning detergents and foodstuffs.

Felista learnt about Milango through advertisements, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is finance for basic needs. 

Felista is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to pay for school fees for her children. She believes that the business has improved well enough to meet the required repayments for the loan.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for items required for events management, e.g., clothes.

loans.name: Mugambi

texts.en: Mugambi's business is running well and he is grateful to those who lent him money to do business. He is faced with a need to pay his child's school fees but does not have the money in a lump sum. He is therefore asking for a loan of 13,770 Kenya shillings to pay his child's school fee. Mugambi believes his current business state can meet the required loan repayment of the new loan, too.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Tunufai

texts.en:
Tunufai is a 42-year-old woman who is married with four children. She runs a business selling general goods and products in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Tunufai has requested a loan to purchase meats, canned foods, soft drinks, snacks, and many other items. She plans to use her profits to improve her family’s living, together with her kids in school. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy Cokes, Fantas, Sprites, flour, sugar, salt, rice, chicken, potatoes, garlic, onions, tomato sauce, and cup noodles.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 60-year-old married woman from Lila, Bohol. She has two grown children. She has been raising hogs for 15 years.

Aside from the hog-raising business, Emma also engages in fruit and vegetable vending. She sells fruits and vegetables to customers in their community.

Emma requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, feed, and more fruits and vegetables to sell. 

In the future, Emma would like to invest in other ventures to improve her status of livelihood, and at the same time, save for old age.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, and fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Reyna works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Reyna is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase a sidecar for her motorcycle transport business.

Reyna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a sidecar for her motorcycle business

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a charcoal seller and has been doing this business for six years. Riziki is a married mother of two school-going children. She also earns some income from rental houses owned by the family.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 48,500 Kenya shillings to purchase a new stock of charcoal and firewood for sale. She will pay her children’s school fees from the extra income. 

Despite the challenge of high cost of transportation, Riziki believes the business has a future and besides her getting the income to educate her children, she looks forward to owning a charcoal wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase a new stock of charcoal and firewood for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and has six children. She is married and has five children who are currently going to school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Elizabeth has been buying and selling livestock for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to finish the education of her children in college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 43 years old and has six children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is 68 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Felina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, spices, noodles, etc.

Felina has been in this business for 22 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, spices, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Marleen

texts.en: Marleen is 31 years old and lives in Camalaniugan. She is married and has two children. For the past two years of being married, life has been a bit difficult for her. Now, to help her husband in acquiring income, she is engaged in a direct selling business. She offers perfumes, make-up and brand-name underwear. To promote her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more perfumes which are in demand, make-up, lipstick and whitening soap. She believes that with these products, she could earn more income to provide them a better living.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes which are in demand, make-up, lipstick and whitening soap

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 37 años, está casada con Nildo, con quien tiene 2 hijas: Mayli y Gabriela. Ésta familia vive en una casa propia ubicada en un distrito rural.
Se dedica a la agricultura, pues es su principal actividad económica. Tiene como 8 años dedicándose a la siembra de flor de gladiolo, arveja, papa y zanahoria. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder comercializar sus cosechas, ya que puede ver el fruto de tanto esfuerzo. Una vez al mes viaja a la capital del país a comercializar la flor de gladiolo que siembra. Par el futuro está trabajadora mujer desea seguir sembrando en mayores cantidades.
“Sembrar de todo es rentable, al cosechar cada producto en cada mes, se obtiene ganancias y así se pueden cubrir los principales gastos”, menciona. 
Se acerca la temporada de siembras de arvejas, por eso requiere de ayuda, porque no quiere quedarse atrás.
Ésta mujer empeñosa piensa iniciar unos sembríos de papas, maíz y arvejas, por ello requiere de su ayuda.
Éste es su crédito número 7 con MFP. Menciona que pagará las cuotas con responsabilidad. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Picaflores de Patay”, donde se siente a gusto por tener socios cuyas metas son similares.
Con los 3800 solicitados los invertirá en la compra de semillas de papas, maíz y flores de gladiolos. Le sobrarán como 1000 soles con los que piensa adquirir bolsas de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Esther is 37 years old, is married to Nildo, with whom she has two daughters: Mayli and Gabriela.  This family lives in their own home located in a rural district.  She works in agriculture as it is her principal economic activity.  She has been working for about 8 years planting the gladiolus flower, peas, potatoes and carrots.  What she likes most about her work is to be able to sell her crops because she can see the fruit of so much effort.  Once a month she travels to the capital of the country to sell the gladiolus flowers that she plants.  For the future this hardworking woman wants to continue planting in greater quantities.  “Plant everything that is profitable, upon harvesting each product each month, profit is obtained and thus one can cover the main expenses,” she mentions.  

The season for planting peas is approaching, for that she needs help because she doesn’t want to be left behind.  This persevering woman intends to start a few fields of potatoes, corn and peas, for that she needs help.  This is her 7th loan with MFP.  She mentions that she will pay the installments responsibly.  She belongs to the communal bank “Los Picaflores de Patay” (The Hummingbirds of Patay) where she feels comfortable, having members whose goals are similar.  With the requested 3800 (PEN), she will invest in the purchase of potato, corn and gladiolus flower seeds.  She will have 1000 soles (PEN) left over with which she intends to purchase bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy potato, gladiolus flower and corn seed and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica de 39 años, vive junto a su esposo Luis y sus 3 hijos a los que quiere mucho. Su casa es propia, que construyeron con esfuerzo, en una zona rural.
Todo lo que tiene se lo debe a su trabajo arduo. Ella es agricultora. Al lado de Luis, se dirige a sus sembríos de papa, olluco, arvejas y habas, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, que gracias al trabajo conjunto que realizan como socios y esposos lograron adquirir. 
Son como 13  años los que lleva como agricultora. En todo este tiempo  afrontó malos momentos como pérdidas de cosechas. Además vivió momentos reconfortantes obteniendo buenas ganancias. Desea más adelante ahorrar el dinero suficiente para poder adquirir un camión y, de esa manera minimizar los gastos de trasporte que realizan de la ciudad al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde lleva a comercializar su cosecha. Además de ayudarle en su negocio de compra y venta de animales.
Las lluvias son importantes en las siembras, por eso aprovechará estos días para sembrar maíz y arvejas.
Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y éste es su crédito número 7 con MFP. En su grupo es una socia trabajadora y muy puntual en sus cuotas.
Destinará el dinero en la compra de semillas de arvejas y maíz. Así también comprará bolsas de fertilizantes orgánicos.
texts.en: Angélica is 39 years old and lives with her husband, Luis, and their three children, whom she loves very much. They own their home, which they constructed with a lot of effort in a rural area in Peru. All that Angélica has she owes to hard work. She is a farmer, and along with Luis she directs the growing of potatoes, tubers, peas and lima beans, which they plant on their own farmlands that they were able to acquire together. Angélica has been farming for 13 years, and over that time she has faced setbacks like losing crops. However, there have been also comforting times with good profits. She hopes in the future to save enough money to get her own truck and in this way minimize the transportation costs of taking her goods to the wholesale market in the city, where she sells her products. Furthermore, she would like to help her business buying and selling animals. Rain is important for planting, so she will take advantage of this time to plant corn and peas. She belongs to the “Picaflores de Patay” community bank, and this is her seventh loan with Kiva partner MFP. She is a hardworking member of her group and very punctual with her payments. She plans to use the loan to purchase pea and corn seeds, as well as bags of organic fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase pea and corn seeds as well as bags of organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store and from farming rice. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 55 years old, married, and has one child. She is operating her small piggery business in their backyard to provide the necessities of her family. She is seeking a loan amount of P 5,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicine to sustain her pigs. With the help of this loan, she'll be able to improve her business and rescue her family’s living situation from financial constraint.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicine

loans.name: Los Rancheros Group

texts.es:
El señor Marcos esta casado, tiene 35 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos quienes están estudiando, El se dedica a la confección de prendas, específicamente la elaboración de pantalones y playeras, trabajo que inició como operario en otro negocio, lleva actualmente 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo trabajo de confección.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que les servirá para la compra de una maquina industrial, esto con el fin de incrementar su producción de pantalones y playeras, espera seguir trabajando fuerte y en el futuro tener varias maquinas y trabajadores  para mayor producción.
texts.en:
Marcos is married and is 35 years old.  He studied three years of elementary school.  He has three children who are attending school.  He makes garments for a living, specifically the production of pants and t-shirts, a job that he began as a worker in another business.  He currently has 10 years of experience.  He has the support of his wife who is also engaged in the same work of making clothing.

He organized a group to apply for a loan that will serve them in the purchase of an industrial sewing machine, this with the aim of increasing their production of pants and t-shirts.  He hopes to continue working hard and in the future have several machines and workers for greater production.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lolita has been in this business for five years. Lolita earns more income from her general store.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Edna Marie

texts.en:
Edna Marie is 43 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Edna Marie is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Edna Marie has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Edna Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy de 34 años está casada con Teófilo con quién tiene 3 hijos: Morelia de 16, Aymer de 8 y Cristian de 4 años. Ellos viven en una casa arrendada ubicada en un distrito rural.
Como toda madre del campo tiene que distribuir su tiempo para atender a sus hijos y la agricultura. Nancy es una madre dulce, pero de carácter persistente.
Con mucho esmero cultiva arvejas, papas de la variedad “Única” y flores de gladiolos. “Cada 4 meses siembro 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas, de las que cosecho 30 sacos”, menciona. Toda su producción la negocia en el mercado mayorista de Tarma.
Así también afirma que con la venta de los gladiolos obtiene más ingresos, por su gran demanda para las ciudades de Huancayo, Lima y La Merced. Las ventas de los gladiolos son más beneficiosas en los meses de mayo y noviembre.
Nancy requiere fertilizar unos terrenos, además necesita semillas de arvejas y maíz. Solicita su apoyo.
Éste es su préstamo número 9 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los Picaflores de Patay”, es el nombre de su banco comunal y le agrada el sistema de trabajo, así como las charlas educativas, según comenta.
Con los 3000 soles solicitados podrá comprar 4 bolsas de semillas de arvejas, además de varias bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Nancy is 34 years old and married to Teofilo with whom she has 3 children: Morelia, age 16, Aymer, age 8, and Cristian, age 4. They live in a rented house located in a rural district.

Like all rural mothers, Nancy has to ration her time between attending to her children and to her farming. Nancy is a sweet mother but also of a persistent character.

With great care, she cultivates her peas, plus the “Unica” variety of potatoes, and gladiolas. “Every 4 months,” Nancy mentions, “I sow 2 sacks of pea seeds, from which I harvest 30 sacks.” All of her production she sells in Tarma's wholesale market.

She reports that from the sale of her gladiolas, she obtains additional income, due to their great demand in the cities of Huancayo, Lima, and La Merced. The sale of the gladiolas is most profitable in the months of May and November.

Nancy needs to fertilize some lands, and also, to sow green pea and corn seeds. For this she is requesting your help. This is her 9th loan through MFP, and she promises to be punctual in making her payments. Nancy's communal bank is called “The Hummingbirds of Patay,” and Nancy says she likes the way it works, in particular the educational talks.

With the 3,000 sols she solicits, she will be able to purchase 4 sacks of green pea seeds, plus various bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: buy 4 sacks of green pea seeds, plus various acks of fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot tiene 33 años es una mujer casada. Vive con su esposo Elmer y sus 2 hijos: Kenler de 15 y Ángel de 4 años. Su vivienda se ubica en un barrio rural y es propia.
Con la fuerza y persistencia que la caracteriza se dedica a la siembra de arvejas y flores de gladiolos, los cuales, desde sus primeros años como agricultura, siempre le dieron buenos resultados. Se dedica a la agricultura desde su juventud.
“Normalmente siembro 1 bolsa y media de arvejas, de las que obtiene 40 sacos”, comenta.
Así mismo produce gladiolos, en este caso sus compradores la visitan hasta sus chacras para negociar las ventas.
Según dice, sus ventas son rentables, porque  los compradores adquieren sus productos al instante y se lo llevan hacia otras ciudades.
De esa manera, Margot obtiene ingresos que, le permiten educar a sus pequeños hijos y ofrecerles algunos gustos. 
Estos días de lluvias le serán de gran ayuda para las siembras de arvejas y flores de gladiolos, por eso requiere de su ayuda. Éste es su crédito número 9 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Los Picaflores de Patay”, es el nombre de su banco comunal. Es una socia responsable en las actividades y pagos.
Con el dinero podrá adquirir 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas con 1500 soles y los 500 restantes serán para comprar semillas de gladiolos.
texts.en: Margot is 33 years old and lives with her husband, Elmer, and their two children: Kenler, 15, and Ángel, 4. They live in their own home in a rural neighborhood. With the hard work and persistence she is known for, Margot makes a living growing peas and gladiolus flowers, which has delivered good results ever since her first years in farming when she was a young woman. "Normally I plant a bag and half of pea seeds, which produces 40 sacks," she says. She grows the gladiolus herself, and buyers visit from other farms to negotiate the sales. She says the business is lucrative because the buyers make their purchases right there and then take them to other cities to resell. In this way Margot earns an income that allows her to educate her children and cover expenses. These days of rain will be a big help for planting peas and gladiolus, which is why she is requesting your help. This will be her ninth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. She belongs to “Los Picaflores de Patay” community bank and is a responsible member. With the loan, she plans to purchase three bags of pea seeds and use the rest to buy gladiolus seeds.

loans.use: to purchase pea and gladiolus seeds.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more stock of nipa to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for four years. Remedios earns more income from a general store.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy more stock of nipa (woven palm mats) to sell.

loans.name: Rosita Coronado

texts.es:
Rosita, 49 años de edad,  originaria de la Comarca Quezalguaque, en las afueras de Teustepe,  casada, madre de 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa. Inicio en la actividad laboral a la edad de 29 años, cosiendo  ropa, ya que ella necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y es por eso que hoy en día con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha podido sacar adelante su negocio de costura, del que se siente muy satisfecha porque le genera ganancias a diarias, cuenta con clientes fijos, este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
Esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar zippers, botones, telas, cinta, encajes, con el objetivo de comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para elaborar sus trajes y poder cumplir con  los encargos que le hacen sus clientela, unos de sus planes futuros es poder seguir manteniendo activo el negocio y estable.
texts.en:
Rosita, 49, is from the county of Quezalguaque on the outskirts of Teustepe.  She is married and has four adult children, and earns a living making and selling clothing.  She began her sewing business at age 29 in an effort to earn an income, and nowadays works hard to make it successful.  Her work generates a daily income from her fixed customers, for which she is very happy.  This is her first business and her goal is to continue expanding.

The loan she needs is to buy zippers, buttons, fabric, ribbon and lace.  Her aim is to have on hand all the raw materials she needs to make her clothing and fill customer orders.  Her future plans are to keep her business active and stable.

loans.use: To buy zippers, buttons, fabric, ribbon and lace.

loans.name: Noemi Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Noemí tiene 55 años de edad, tres hijos dos de los cuales son varones y una hembra. Actualmente, ella vive con un nieto de ocho años de edad y un hijo de 22 años y es bachiller automotriz, con proyección de estudiar Ingeniería el próximo año;  dos de sus hijos viven en el extranjero. 

Se dedico a elaborar y vender tortillas durante 22 años, actualmente solo hace tamales para la venta, debido a que un doctor le prohibió trabajar en la elaboración de tortillas por el fuego. Este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá quien le enseñó a una hermana y ella. Las materias primas las compra en el mercado, el que se encuentra situado  1.5 kilómetros de su vivienda.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar dos terrenos de vivienda. 


El préstamo le ayudará a que el vendedor del terreno le haga la venta legal y pueda asegurar la inversión que a realizado. Esto previendo a que el vendedor no estará en el país y teme tener dificultades a futuro.

Su deseo es, Instalar una tienda para mejorar los ingresos familiares y apoyar económicamente a su hijo para que estudie la ingeniería en la Universidad.
Anteriormente manejó su propia tienda y dejó de hacerlo por problemas delincuenciales.
texts.en:
Noemí, 55, has three children: two sons and a daughter.  She currently lives with an 8-year-old grandson and her 22-year-old son who is in technical high school and will go on to study engineering next year.  Two of her children live overseas.  

Noemí has been making and selling tortillas for 22 years, although now she only makes and sells tamales because her doctor does not allow her to cook tortillas over fire.  She learned her trade from her mother who taught both her and her sister.  She buys supplies at the market which is 1.5 kilometers from her house.

The loan she is requesting through Fundación Campo is to pay off two plots of land she purchased.  The loan will mean the person selling the land will have to make it legal before possibly leaving the country, which would make things difficult for her.

Her goal is to set up a store to earn more income and support her son so he can study engineering at the university.  She used to run her own store but had to close it because of crime.

loans.use: To pay off land purchases.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 42 years of age, and very inspired in operating a variety store. She needs to have a strongly performing business in order to provide her family with  a better standard of living. She has operated this business for four years. She would like to boost her income so that she can save funds for her children’s education. Elena is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase biscuits, breads, soft drinks, and canned goods. She is hoping that these goods will increase her turnover and provide more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, breads, soft drinks, and canned goods

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
Nerida de 36 años está casada con Manuel, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Karelyn de 16 y Arnol de 9 años. Esta familia habita un hogar propio en una localidad agrícola. Hace 15 años labora en terrenos de su propiedad y en otros que arrienda, le agrada el trabajo del campo. La agricultura es su principal actividad y la fuente de sus ingresos.
“Siembro arvejas, papas y gladiolos”, comenta, añadiendo que es más rentable la cosecha de gladiolos, ya que cada paquete lo vende a 70 soles.
En cuanto a su rentabilidad dice que, le conviene llevar sus productos hacia el mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde desde muy temprano, vendedores y compradores circulan la zona, en busca de ventas y compras satisfactorias.
Por esa razón Nerida no descuida sus sembríos y cada vez siembra un poco más. De esta manera piensa adquirir otras parcelas en otros distritos para producir hortalizas.
Ésta vez iniciará una jornada de trabajo intensa. Sembrará maíz, papas y arvejas. Su inversión será importante. Éste es su crédito número 9 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “los Picaflores de Patay”. Agradece mucho tantos años de confianza hacia su persona y el apoyo con las charlas educativas.
Destinará el dinero en la compra de bolsas de semillas de arvejas, papas, y gladiolos. Además comprará fertilizantes y pagará los servicios de los jornaleros que contratará para esas actividades.
texts.en:
Nerida, 36, is married to Manuel and they have two children, Karelyn, 16, and Arnol, 9.  They live in their own house in a farming community where they have worked their own land for 15 years, enjoying what they do.  They also rent land, so agriculture is their main source of income.

"I grow peas, potatoes and gladiolus.", she says, adding that the most profitable crop is the gladiolus since she can sell each packet for 70 PEN.  Regarding profitability, she says it is better if she takes her produce to the wholesale market in Tarma, where buyers and sellers arrive early in the morning in search of bargains.

That is why Nerida is careful with her crops and aims to expand each season.  She wants to buy more land in other districts to grow vegetables.

She is about to begin the arduous job of sowing corn, potatoes and peas, which makes for an important investment.  This is her ninth loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time.  She belongs to the communal bank "los Picaflores de Patay" and is very grateful for all the years of trust shown to her and the support from the training talks.

She will use the loan to buy bags of pea, potato and gladiolus seeds and fertilizer, and hire workers.

loans.use: To buy bags of pea, potato and gladiolus seeds and hire workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay off another loan and to use as working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy supplies to make tortillas, such as corn, firewood, gas, bags, etc.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 41 years old and engaged in the retailing business. She has been running her business for four years. She usually sells different products in their market. 

Concepcion is married to Renato, the father of her children, who helps her to manage their business. The couple are thankful because they have been blessed with four children. Concepcion wants to have additional capital. She is therefore asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 9,000 to buy playing cards, cotton buds, batteries, toothbrushes, combs and nail cutters to sell. 

She hopes to grow and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy playing cards, cotton buds, batteries, toothbrushes, combs and nail cutters to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 56 years old, married and has three children. 

Elena is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
This is Rosalina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed materials for her business. She and her partners in this business are working hard for its continuous success. Aside from her stainless steel business, she also manufactures and sells doormats and rugs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy supplies like glass, stainless steel materials, silicon and other materials needed in making stainless products. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and manage the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosalina dreams of having a happy and peaceful life and hopes that her business will continue to grow. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies like glass, stainless steel materials, silicon and other materials used in the business

loans.name: Melchie

texts.en:
Melchie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Melchie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Melchie has been in this business for seven years now. The photo shows Melchie together with her child.

In the future, Melchie would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 59 years old and widowed with eight children. 

She has a hog fattening business as a source of income and to help towards looking after her children’s expenses. 

She focuses on her business in order to achieve a higher income. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and vitamins. 

She hopes to earn a higher income this time for the financial security of her business and family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia, 47 and resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gaspar, a garbage collector and father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilia operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, ranging from round palm sized ones, to the much larger doormats, but also offers other crafts that most rug-makers come across every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, they are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabrics, threads and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lilia dreams of expanding her business further and hopes that her business will grow even more. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabrics, cloth, threads and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline is a 28-year-old woman from Ubay, Bohol. 

She has been engaged in the rice farming business for more than ten years now. 

Adeline is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. 

Adeline hopes of expanding her business in the future and making it sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is married with seven children. Six of her children are working whilst her youngest child goes to school. 

Clarita has managed a home-based store for 20 years. The profits gained from her business go towards their daily necessities, children's allowances and monthly electric bills.

Clarita wishes to have a stable source of income, so she could let her youngest child finish her studies and have comfortable living conditions. 

To realize all these things, she is seeking additional capital of PHP 7,000 to allow her to buy stocks of groceries, such as soft drinks, eggs, onions, garlic and sugar for her home-based store. 

She knows that the loan amount she has requested will really be a big help in making her business productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries, such as soft drinks, eggs, onions, garlic and sugar for her home-based store

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is married and is the mother of four children. 

She is 25 years of age and is a very industrious hog-raiser. She has been involved in raising pigs for over four years. She earns an income of PHP 10,000 from previous sales and uses this to improve their living situation. 

She wants to achieve a higher income to save for the education of her children. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and vitamins. 

She just hopes to be able to improve her hogs to achieve an enhanced profit and also lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia. She previously accessed an 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase the scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She is a widow and she continues to work to provide an income for her daily needs and to be able to help her children.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lilia dreams of having her own place for her junk shop and hopes to have good health always. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les 10  femmes du groupe Mougnou  ont  en moyenne 41ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes la ville de Tominian    dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de poissons, condiments et la vente de divers articles. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe  intègrent  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er prêt solidaire.
Madame, TENIN  (1 ère personne debout  de la gauche  vers la droite) est très connue dans son activité  de vente de poissons fumés et frais  de tous dans la ville.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 cartons de fumés et 5 cartons de poissons frais. Elle s’approvisionne  auprès des grossistes à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, à domicile,  à la foire les Samedis et  dans les grandes foires environnants. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame TENIN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married and living in extended, traditional families, the 10 women of the Mougnou group have an average age of 41 and, on average, 6 children. They all live in the town of Tominian in the Ségou region (4th administrative district of Mali) and got to know each other through neighbourly and family relationships, and marriage. They are small resellers of fish, condiments and various other items. The members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business and are on their first group loan.

Tenin (the first person standing on the left in the picture) is well known by everyone in town for the smoked and fresh fish that she sells. She plans to use her loan to buy 3 boxes of smoked fish and 5 boxes of fresh fish. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in San. She makes her sales for cash or credit, door-to-door, at the Saturday market and at the large market fairs in the surrounding area, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. Thanks to this loan, Tenin hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of the household needs.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les femmes du groupe SOUTOURA ont  en moyenne 38  ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes la ville de TOMINIAN dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat la restauration et la vente de condiments. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe soutoura ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 8 e prêt solidaire
Madame, NIANA  femme debout au milieu compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de riz décortiqué, 2 sacs d’oignon frais de 50 kg, un seau de 25 kg de pâte d’arachide, 2 cartons de Maggi et une grande quantité d’épices. Elle  effectue ses ventes   au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle composée de   femmes et d’hommes  à la foire de TOMINIAN et les jours ordinaires et  à domicile.
Avec ce prêt, Madame NIANA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married and living in extended, traditional families, the women of the Soutoura group have an average age of 38 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in the town of Tominian in the Ségou region (4th administrative district of Mali) and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and family relationships. They buy and sell condiments and prepare food. The members of the Soutoura group joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business and are on their 8th group loan.

Niana (the person standing in the middle of the back row the picture) plans to use her loan to buy 3 boxes of dehusked rice, 2 bags (50kgs) of fresh onions, a 25kg-pail of peanut butter, 2 boxes of Maggi stock cubes and a large quantity of spices. She makes her sales for cash or credit, at the Tominian market fair and door-to-door on non-market days, to a retail clientèle made up of women and men. Thanks to this loan, Niana hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of the household needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Marichu works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marichu is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Marichu has been sustaining her business activities with her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and  to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 40 years old and married with four children.

Marlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs an ambulant produce business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of onion, garlic, carrots, etc. to sell.

Marlene has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this business for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending.
Marlene aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of onion, garlic, carrots, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
This is Pedro. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy all the needed products for his variety store which gave him an increased income. He has had this business for five years now. He is single and he works hard to provide income for his everyday expenses.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan that he will be utilizing to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add into his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Pedro hopes to have strength and good health to continue his responsibilities. He dreams that his business will continue to grow. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for his store.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 57-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol.  She has engaged in hog raising and rice farming for more than 30 years now. This is the source of their income. Aida is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs and fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising and rice farming ventures thus augmenting her income and profit. In the future, Aida dreams of making her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs and fertlizer for the farm.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda is engaged in hog-raising in the village of Centro 2. She is 30 years old and is married. They are blessed with three children. Esmeralda works hard to support their daily needs and to help her children financially. She wants to develop her business and increase her income. To this end, Esmeralda wants to borrow PHP 40,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted so she can develop her business and purchase more hogs to raise.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Lee Marvin

texts.en: Lee Marvin is 26 years old, married and has one infant-aged child. He aims to become financially stable to give his family a better life. Farming is the main source of their living, but due to insufficient income, Lee Marvin runs a small variety store in the village to generate additional income. He plans to increase his product offerings to satisfy his customers' demand but due to inadequate capital needs a loan to do so.  He is asking for an additional PHP 18,000 to buy more stock of shampoos, soaps, soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell. He believes that this loan will make it possible to improve the business and hopes that he will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shampoos, soaps, soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is 36 years of age, a hardworking and loving mother. She has been engaged in the caring of pigs since she was married to Renie. This is her way of making an income for her family. She carefully takes care of her business to gain higher profits. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Rio is 32 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rio buys and sells bananas in the Philippines. Rio requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.
Rio has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Rio would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia runs a beauty salon in the town of Angadanan and requested a PHP 15,000 loan to buy beauty products such as make-up kits, dyes, medicines for re-bonding and hot oil for her beauty salon. She has been in this business for more than two years and is thankful for the improvement of her living conditions. She believes that the financial assistance will help her business. In the future she will be successful, as she continues to work hard.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as make-up kits, dyes, medicines for re-bonding and hot oil for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Simplecia

texts.en:
Simplecia works hard to support her family. Simplecia is married buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines.

Simplecia requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell.
Simplecia has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Simplecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Superiana

texts.en:
Superiana is married with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Superiana is 58 years old and has one child who is in school.
